analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom gyis brgal bar dka' ba ste /

analyzed: lam gzhan la brten pa dang / lam la the tshom za ba'i phyir te ;

analyzed: 'di ltar / 'gro mi 'dod dang lam nor dang // lam la the tshom de snyed cig / thar pa bgrod la gegs byed pa //

original: de yi phyir na gsum bstan to //
analyzed: de yi phyir na gsum bstan to //

original: zhes bshad do //üîΩyang na ji ltar 'dam mi 'bral ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir kun du chags pa'i gnas yin la /
analyzed: zhes bshad do // yang na ji ltar 'dam mi 'bral ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir kun du chags pa'i gnas yin la /

translated: Or, just as a swamp is a place of attachment because it is the nature of something from which one cannot extricate oneself, and just as a swamp is difficult to cross because one is mired down in it, so samsara is a place of attachment due to the attachment of passion, and samsara is difficult to cross because one is mired down in it.

original: rdzu 'phrul dang / kun brjod pa dag gis ni sems can rnams rang sa pa tsam zhig tu 'gyur na /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang / kun brjod pa dag gis ni sems can rnams rang sa pa tsam zhig tu 'gyur na /
translated: By miracles and by predictions, beings are only brought to their own level.

original: rangs pa tsam gyis ni nyon mongs pa spong ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rangs pa tsam gyis ni nyon mongs pa spong ba yang ma yin no //
translated: But afflictions are not abandoned merely by being pleased.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni 'khor ba'i rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa spangs pa med par 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni 'khor ba'i rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa spangs pa med par 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Since the afflictions are the root of cyclic existence, without the abandonment of the afflictions there is no crossing over the swamp of cyclic existence.

original: de'i phyir rdzu 'phrul dang / dam pa sbyin pa'i mthus 'khor ba'i 'dam las drangs pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdzu 'phrul dang / dam pa sbyin pa'i mthus 'khor ba'i 'dam las drangs pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no pulling out of the swamp of cyclic existence by the power of miracles and giving the highest gift.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dir ni gzhan gyis ston pa dang / bstan pa dang / slob ma dag las bcom ldan 'das pa dag dang / de'i bstan pa dang / de'i slob ma rnams khyad par du 'phags par brjod de /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dir ni gzhan gyis ston pa dang / bstan pa dang / slob ma dag las bcom ldan 'das pa dag dang / de'i bstan pa dang / de'i slob ma rnams khyad par du 'phags par brjod de /
translated: This verse shows that the Lord, his teaching, and his disciples are superior to others, teachers, teachings, and disciples.

original: spangs pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir dang / 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal ba'i thabs yin pa'i phyir dang / 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spangs pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir dang / 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal ba'i thabs yin pa'i phyir dang / 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is endowed with the perfection of abandonment and knowledge, because his teaching is the means of crossing the swamp of cyclic existence, and because his disciples have crossed the swamp of cyclic existence.

original: gzhan dag ni ston par khas blangs par zad kyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ston par khas blangs par zad kyi /
translated: Others are merely accepted as teachers,

original: spangs pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: spangs pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ma yin la /
translated: but they are not endowed with the perfection of abandonment and knowledge.

original: de dag gi bstan pa ni 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal ba'i thabs ma yin zhing de dag gi slob ma rnams kyang 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal ba ma yin no zhes don gyis bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi bstan pa ni 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal ba'i thabs ma yin zhing de dag gi slob ma rnams kyang 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal ba ma yin no zhes don gyis bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Their teachings are not the means of crossing the swamp of cyclic existence, and their disciples have not crossed the swamp of cyclic existence. This is the implicit teaching.

original: yang na go rims bzhin du spangs pa'i mthar phyin pa dang / ye shes kyi mthar phyin pa dang / gzhan la phan pa'i mthar phyin pa dang / gzhan @11a * //
analyzed: yang na go rims bzhin du spangs pa'i mthar phyin pa dang / ye shes kyi mthar phyin pa dang / gzhan la phan pa'i mthar phyin pa dang / gzhan @11a * //
translated: Or else, in order, they are the perfection of abandonment, the perfection of transcendent wisdom, the perfection of benefit for others and the perfection of time.üîΩ

original: la phan pa'i thabs kyi mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: la phan pa'i thabs kyi mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: Or else, respectively, he has perfected the abandonment, he has perfected the intuition, he has perfected the benefit for others, and he has perfected the means for the benefit of others.

original: de ltar bdag dang gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa de lta bu dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa de lta bu dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, he is endowed with the perfection of benefit for self and others.

original: de ltar gyi sgra ni ji skad bshad pa'i bstod pa'i rnam par bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyi sgra ni ji skad bshad pa'i bstod pa'i rnam par bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word thus indicates the praise already explained.

original: spangs pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pas bdag la phan pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa yin la /üîΩdam pa'i chos ston pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i ston pa po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spangs pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pas bdag la phan pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa yin la / dam pa'i chos ston pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i ston pa po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: He is endowed with the perfection of benefit for self because he is endowed with the perfection of abandonment and intuition.

original: gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with the perfection of benefit for others because he is the teacher of the holy Dharma together with its result.

original: tshogs bsnyad nas zhes bya bas gus pa'i khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshogs bsnyad nas zhes bya bas gus pa'i khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwith a great assembly‚Äù indicates the special respect.üîΩ

original: phyag 'tshal nas zhes bya ba ni mgos btud nas so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal nas zhes bya ba ni mgos btud nas so zhes bshad do //
translated: The word having worshipped is explained as having bowed one's head.

original: gal te na ma'i sgra dang ldan na bzhi par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te na ma'i sgra dang ldan na bzhi par 'gyur na /
translated: If it has the sound of nama, it would be the fourth case.

original: 'di na ni na ma'i sgra med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'di na ni na ma'i sgra med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But here there is no sound of nama, is there?

original: nyes pa 'di ni med de /
analyzed: nyes pa 'di ni med de /
translated: There is no fault.

original: yang dag par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don can gyi bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don can gyi bzhi pa'o //
translated: It is the fourth case with the sense of the nature of correct performance.

original: 'di ltar bya ba smos pa brjod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ba smos pa brjod de /
translated: Thus, the act of worship is stated.

original: khyim thab la nyal 'gyed pa la go bgos zhes nyal ba ngang bgo ba'i bya bas khyim thab dang g-yul 'gyed pa mngon par 'dod pas yang dag par sbyin pa'i bzhi pa grub pa de bzhin du 'dir yang phyag 'tshal bas ston pa mngon par 'dod par byed
analyzed: khyim thab la nyal 'gyed pa la go bgos zhes nyal ba ngang bgo ba'i bya bas khyim thab dang g-yul 'gyed pa mngon par 'dod pas yang dag par sbyin pa'i bzhi pa grub pa de bzhin du 'dir yang phyag 'tshal bas ston pa mngon par 'dod par byed
translated: Just as in the expression having put on armor for lovemaking with one's husband, the act of putting on armor is for the purpose of lovemaking with one's husband, and the fourth case is established by the desire to engage in battle, in the same way, here also, the act of worship is for the purpose of desiring to make offerings to the teacher.

original: pa po'i mtshan nyid kho na'i bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: pa po'i mtshan nyid kho na'i bzhi pa yin no //
translated: It is the fourth case with the sense of the nature of the agent alone.

original: btud nas kyi sgra ni na ma'i sgra dang don 'dra bas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: btud nas kyi sgra ni na ma'i sgra dang don 'dra bas nyes pa med do //
translated: The word ‚Äúhaving bowed‚Äù is similar in meaning to the word ‚Äúhaving paid homage,‚Äù and so there is no fault.

original: de la phyag 'tshal nas zhes gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal nas zhes gsungs pa la /
translated: With regard to the statement ‚Äúhaving paid homage,‚Äù

original: byed pa po mtshungs pa'i bya ba gnyis kyis sngar gyi dus kyi bya ba la gnas bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: byed pa po mtshungs pa'i bya ba gnyis kyis sngar gyi dus kyi bya ba la gnas bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: the act of paying homage is established as a prior act by means of two acts that are similar in being acts.

original: dper na khrus byas nas bza'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na khrus byas nas bza'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the statement ‚Äúhaving bathed, he eats.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir bya ba gzhan la bltas pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bya ba gzhan la bltas pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúwhat is the use of looking at another act?‚Äù

original: slob dpon gyis kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang /
translated: The master also says,

original: bstan bcos rab bshad bya /üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bstan bcos rab bshad bya / zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúI will explain the treatise.‚Äù

original: slob ma 'chos pas na bstan bcos te /
analyzed: slob ma 'chos pas na bstan bcos te /
translated: A treatise is that which corrects disciples.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ; nye ba'i nyon mongs ba kun tu rgyu'i dbang gis lam gol bar rgyu ba'i slob ma bstan bcos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i lam la 'jog pa'o //üîΩ'chos pas na bstan bcos sam /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ; nye ba'i nyon mongs ba kun tu rgyu'i dbang gis lam gol bar rgyu ba'i slob ma bstan bcos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i lam la 'jog pa'o // 'chos pas na bstan bcos sam /
translated: It is a treatise because it establishes disciples who are traveling on a wrong path due to the power of the causes of the afflictions and secondary afflictions, such as desire, on the path that accords with the treatise.üîΩIt is a treatise because it corrects.

original: 'dis 'chos pas na bstan bcos so //
analyzed: 'dis 'chos pas na bstan bcos so //
translated: It is a treatise because it corrects by means of this.

original: rnam pa gcig tu ni nyon mongs pa'i sgra 'chos pa dang / @11b ngan 'gro dang srid pa las skyob pas na bstan bcos te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu ni nyon mongs pa'i sgra 'chos pa dang / @11b ngan 'gro dang srid pa las skyob pas na bstan bcos te /
translated: bad rebirths, and cyclic existence.üîΩThese two qualities do not exist in other systems.üîΩWhat is a treatise? It is a treatise because it protects from the afflictions, bad rebirths, and cyclic existence.

original: nyon mongs dgra rnams ma lus 'chos pa dang // ngan 'gro srid las skyob pa gang yin de //
analyzed: nyon mongs dgra rnams ma lus 'chos pa dang // ngan 'gro srid las skyob pa gang yin de //
translated: What is a treatise? It is a treatise because it protects from the afflictions, bad rebirths, and cyclic existence.üîΩThese two qualities do not exist in other systems.

original: 'chos skyob yon tan phyir na bstan bcos te //
analyzed: 'chos skyob yon tan phyir na bstan bcos te //
translated: What is a treatise? It is a treatise because it protects from the afflictions, bad rebirths, and cyclic existence.üîΩWhat is a treatise? It is a treatise because it protects from the afflictions, bad rebirths, and cyclic existence.

original: gnyis po 'di dag gzhan gyi lugs la med //üîΩces ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnyis po 'di dag gzhan gyi lugs la med // ces ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: These two qualities do not exist in other systems.üîΩWhat is a treatise? It is a treatise because it protects from the afflictions, bad rebirths, and cyclic existence.üîΩWhat is a treatise? original: bstan bcos gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni ming ci zhig ces bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: bstan bcos gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni ming ci zhig ces bya ba'i don te /
translated: What is a treatise? It is a treatise because it protects from the afflictions, bad rebirths, and cyclic existence.

original: de'i phyir / chos mngon mdzod ces gsungs so //üîΩchos mngon pa smos pa ni bstan bcos khyad par du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir / chos mngon mdzod ces gsungs so // chos mngon pa smos pa ni bstan bcos khyad par du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These two qualities do not exist in other systems.üîΩWhat is a treatise? It is a treatise because it protects from the afflictions, bad rebirths, and cyclic existence.

original: mdzod smos pa ni chos mngon pa'i bsdus pa'i ngo bor shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdzod smos pa ni chos mngon pa'i bsdus pa'i ngo bor shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: What is a treatise? It is a treatise because it protects from the afflictions, bad rebirths, and cyclic existence.

original: 'di'i mdzod chos mngon pa yin pa'am /
analyzed: 'di'i mdzod chos mngon pa yin pa'am /
translated: These two qualities do not exist in other systems.

original: chos mngon pa'i mdzod yin pas chos mngon ba mdzod do //
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i mdzod yin pas chos mngon ba mdzod do //
translated: What is a treatise? It is a treatise because it protects from the afflictions, bad rebirths, and cyclic existence.

original: ci'i phyir 'di brtsams she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di brtsams she na /
translated: Why was this composed?

original: chos mngon pa rgyas pa bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos mngon pa rgyas pa bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to summarize the Abhidharma in an extensive way.

original: de lta yin dang bya ba du mas sems g-yeng ba dang blo zhan pa rnams rjes su gzung bar byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang bya ba du mas sems g-yeng ba dang blo zhan pa rnams rjes su gzung bar byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were like that, it would be a means of caring for those whose minds are distracted by many activities and those of weak intellect.

original: de la gang la bstod pa dang / ji ltar dang / gang gi don du bstod pa de tshigs su bcad pa 'di ngo bstan to //
analyzed: de la gang la bstod pa dang / ji ltar dang / gang gi don du bstod pa de tshigs su bcad pa 'di ngo bstan to //
translated: In this regard, the praise, the manner of praise, and the purpose of the praise are indicated by this verse.

original: chos mngon mdzod ces smras pa na tshig bsdu ba'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir gnyis dam bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos mngon mdzod ces smras pa na tshig bsdu ba'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir gnyis dam bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: When it is said ‚Äúthe Abhidharma treasury,‚Äù since it is a compound word, two things are asserted:üîΩthe Abhidharma treasury

original: chos mngon pa mdzod do //
analyzed: chos mngon pa mdzod do //
translated: and the Abhidharma.

original: chos mngon pa dmigs kyis dgar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos mngon pa dmigs kyis dgar ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to specify the Abhidharma,

original: chos mngon pa zhes bya ba 'di gang zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: chos mngon pa zhes bya ba 'di gang zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúWhat is this called Abhidharma?‚Äù

original: yan lag gi don dmigs kyis dgar na tshig bsdu ba'i don bde blag tu khong du chud par 'gyur ro //üîΩchos mngon shes rab dri med rjes 'brang bcas //
analyzed: yan lag gi don dmigs kyis dgar na tshig bsdu ba'i don bde blag tu khong du chud par 'gyur ro // chos mngon shes rab dri med rjes 'brang bcas //
translated: If the meaning of the component words is specified, the meaning of the compound word is easily understood.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Abhidharma is stainless wisdom together with its following.üîΩHere, the Abhidharma is stainless wisdom.

original: shes rab smos pa ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes rab smos pa ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Wisdom is mentioned because it is the principal factor.

original: chos mngon pa ni phung po lnga'i zhes 'byung bas shes rab kho na chos mngon pa ni ma yin no //üîΩchos rab tu rnam par 'byed ba'o zhes bya ba ni chos rnams rnam par phye ste /
analyzed: chos mngon pa ni phung po lnga'i zhes 'byung bas shes rab kho na chos mngon pa ni ma yin no // chos rab tu rnam par 'byed ba'o zhes bya ba ni chos rnams rnam par phye ste /
translated: The Abhidharma is not just wisdom, since it is said that the Abhidharma is the five aggregates.üîΩIt is the thorough differentiation of phenomena.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the thorough differentiation of phenomena, the understanding of their general and specific characteristics.

original: dri med ces bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dri med ces bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is stainless, because it excludes that which is contaminated.

original: don dam pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said to be the ultimate.

original: dri ma rnams ni zag pa'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir zag pa med pa'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: dri ma rnams ni zag pa'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir zag pa med pa'o zhes smos te /
translated: It is uncontaminated, because the contaminants are synonyms for stains.

original: de la 'dod chags la sogs pa zag pa rnams kun tu rgyas par mi 'gyur bas na zag pa med pa'o //üîΩyang ci shes rab dri ma @12a * //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags la sogs pa zag pa rnams kun tu rgyas par mi 'gyur bas na zag pa med pa'o // yang ci shes rab dri ma @12a * //
translated: It is uncontaminated, because the contaminants such as attachment do not increase it.

original: med pa kho na chos mngon pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: med pa kho na chos mngon pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is uncontaminated wisdom alone the Abhidharma?

original: smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa ma yin no //
translated: No, it is not.

original: 'on ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'on ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: rjes 'brang bcas so //
analyzed: rjes 'brang bcas so //
translated: It is accompanied by its following.

original: rjes su 'brang ba ni shes rab kyi 'khor te /
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba ni shes rab kyi 'khor te /
translated: The retinue of wisdom is that which accompanies it.

original: dus dang 'bras bu la sogs pa dag dang / dge ba nyid kyis shes rab kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa sems las byung ba rnams dang / sems dang / de dag gi thob pa dang / skye ba la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: dus dang 'bras bu la sogs pa dag dang / dge ba nyid kyis shes rab kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa sems las byung ba rnams dang / sems dang / de dag gi thob pa dang / skye ba la sogs pa dag go //
translated: The form, feeling, etc., that accompany wisdom, such as virtue, time, result, etc., are the mental factors that accompany wisdom, the mind, and the obtainment of those, their birth, etc.

original: de la mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan khyad par can la brten pa'i shes rab la ni gang gis gang de skad du bshad pa yang dag pa'i dag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'cho bas bsdus pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyang rjes su 'jug par yod do //
analyzed: de la mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan khyad par can la brten pa'i shes rab la ni gang gis gang de skad du bshad pa yang dag pa'i dag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'cho bas bsdus pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyang rjes su 'jug par yod do //
translated: In the wisdom that is based on the unrestricted state and the special meditative stabilization, the unmanifest form that is included in correct effort and correct livelihood also accompanies it.

original: de ltar na zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga la chos mngon pa zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga la chos mngon pa zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the five uncontaminated aggregates are called Abhidharma.

original: gzugs med pa gsum la brten pa'i chos mngon pa ni phung po bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa gsum la brten pa'i chos mngon pa ni phung po bzhi pa'o //
translated: The Abhidharma that is based on the three formless states is the four aggregates.

original: gal te sems las byung ba thams cad kyi rten yin pa'i phyir sems nyid gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: gal te sems las byung ba thams cad kyi rten yin pa'i phyir sems nyid gtso bo yin te /
translated: If mind is primary because it is the basis of all mental factors,

original: de'i phyir de nyid dri ma med pa rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa chos mngon pa yin la rag mod ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid dri ma med pa rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa chos mngon pa yin la rag mod ce na /
translated: then it is mind itself that is the pure transcendent wisdom and its retinue.

original: bya ba dang / mthong ba dang / dmigs pa mngon par rtogs pa la nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba dang / mthong ba dang / dmigs pa mngon par rtogs pa la nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is capable of engaging in action, seeing, and comprehending objects,üîΩwisdom is primary in comparison to other mental factors.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba gzhan dag bas gtso bo yin pa de'i phyir shes rab kho na rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa la chos mngon par brjod kyi /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba gzhan dag bas gtso bo yin pa de'i phyir shes rab kho na rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa la chos mngon par brjod kyi /
translated: Therefore, only wisdom and its retinue are called the transcendent wisdom of the Abhidharma.

original: sems ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems ni ma yin te /
translated: Mind is not.

original: de'i phyir zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi dbang po rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa ni don dam pa'i chos mngon pa'i zhes legs par bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi dbang po rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa ni don dam pa'i chos mngon pa'i zhes legs par bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the uncontaminated faculty of wisdom and its retinue is the transcendent wisdom of ultimate reality.

original: re zhig 'di ni don dam pa'i dgos pa can te /
analyzed: re zhig 'di ni don dam pa'i dgos pa can te /
translated: This is the ultimate purpose of the Abhidharma.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dgos pa can yin pas don dam pa yin pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba bzhin du rang gi don la 'phel ba bsgrubs pas don dam pa nyid don dam pa pa'o //

analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa kho @26b na'o zhes de las gzhan pa chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i gzugs mdo sde pa la sogs pas kun brtags pa rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is nonindicative form alone because this excludes form that is included in the phenomena base and imagined by Sautrantikas and so on.

original: dang gi sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: dang gi sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The word and has the meaning of inclusion.

original: mig la sogs pa dag gam /üîΩde dag gi rnam par shes pa dag gis rtogs pas na don te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dag gam / de dag gi rnam par shes pa dag gis rtogs pas na don te /

original: khong du chud cas bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khong du chud cas bya ba'i don to //
translated: They are objects because they are comprehended.

original: 'dir skye mched bcu dang / gcig gi phyogs gcig yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir skye mched bcu dang / gcig gi phyogs gcig yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here it is taught that the ten bases and one part of the phenomena base are form.

original: ci ste 'di dag gi mtshan nyid ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci ste 'di dag gi mtshan nyid ci zhig ce na /
translated: What are their characteristics?

original: de'i phyir / de dag rnams kyi rnam shes rten //üîΩmig la sogs gzugs dang ba rnams //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de dag rnams kyi rnam shes rten // mig la sogs gzugs dang ba rnams //
translated: Therefore, the root text says,üîΩThe eye and so on are the support for those consciousnesses.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩbar du chod pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te / bar du chod pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: The eye and so on are the support for those consciousnesses.

original: de'i sgra ni 'jig rten la grags pa khas blangs te /
analyzed: de'i sgra ni 'jig rten la grags pa khas blangs te /
translated: The word ‚Äúthose‚Äù is used because they are well known in the world.

original: gzugs la sogs pa don rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa don rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúthose‚Äù should be applied to the objects such as form.

original: 'jig rten na ni gzugs kyi blo sgra'i blo zhes yul gyi sgo nas rnam par shes pa ston gyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten na ni gzugs kyi blo sgra'i blo zhes yul gyi sgo nas rnam par shes pa ston gyi /
translated: In the world, consciousness is indicated by its object, as in the expressions ‚Äúconsciousness of form‚Äù and ‚Äúconsciousness of sound.‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not indicated by the consciousness itself.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs las kyang /üîΩde ni gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs las kyang / de ni gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa yin gyi /
translated: In the Collection on Topics, it says,

original: gang zag gi rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gang zag gi rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is consciousness of form, not consciousness of a person.‚Äù

original: de dag rnams kyi rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rten rnams ni de dag rnams kyi rnam shes rten te /
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rten rnams ni de dag rnams kyi rnam shes rten te /
translated: The supports for those consciousnesses are the supports for consciousness.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said,

original: de dag gyur pas gyur nyid phyir //
analyzed: de dag gyur pas gyur nyid phyir //
translated: Because they are the same when they transform,

original: rten ni mig la sogs pa yin ;üîΩ/ zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rten ni mig la sogs pa yin ;üîΩ/ zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: The eye and so on are the supports.

original: gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid lnga po zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid lnga po zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin can no //
translated: The five that have the nature of clarity of form are of the nature of form.

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i don rtogs pa ni lung ngam rigs pa las 'gyur la /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i don rtogs pa ni lung ngam rigs pa las 'gyur la /
translated: The understanding of a meaning that is beyond the senses is from scripture or reasoning.

original: yid ches pa ma yin pa rnams kyi tshig gis ni gus par byed pa yang ma yin pas /
analyzed: yid ches pa ma yin pa rnams kyi tshig gis ni gus par byed pa yang ma yin pas /
translated: The words of those who are not trustworthy are not to be respected.

original: mig la sogs gzugs dang ba rnams //
analyzed: mig la sogs gzugs dang ba rnams //
translated: The five that are clear forms are the eye, etc.

original: zhes bya ba 'di la lung ston pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la lung ston pa ni /
translated: The scripture that teaches this is the following passage from the sutra:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: de la dang ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la dang ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of clarity is this.

original: dper na me long dang ba'am chu'i snod du gzugs la brten nas de'i snang ba gzugs brnyan 'byung ba de bzhin du gzugs kyi bdag nyid can dang ba lnga po la yang gzugs la sogs pa dag la brten nas de'i snang ba'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dper na me long dang ba'am chu'i snod du gzugs la brten nas de'i snang ba gzugs brnyan 'byung ba de bzhin du gzugs kyi bdag nyid can dang ba lnga po la yang gzugs la sogs pa dag la brten nas de'i snang ba'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ngo //
translated: Just as a reflection of form arises in dependence on a clear mirror or a clear vessel of water, in the same way, the reflection of form, etc. arises in dependence on the five that have the nature of clarity and are of the nature of form.

original: 'dir gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / rten gyi dngos po khyad par med pa'i phyir na mig la sogs pa rnams phan tshun dang / yod @27a * //
analyzed: 'dir gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / rten gyi dngos po khyad par med pa'i phyir na mig la sogs pa rnams phan tshun dang / yod @27a * //
translated: Here, the eye and so on are mutually distinguished because there is no difference in their nature as form and because there is no difference in their support.

original: las rnam par gcad par bya dgos te /
analyzed: las rnam par gcad par bya dgos te /
translated: They are also distinguished from the other faculties.

original: de'i phyir de dag rnams kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten dang / gzugs dang bas zhes bya ba gnyis ka brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag rnams kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten dang / gzugs dang bas zhes bya ba gnyis ka brjod do //
translated: Therefore, both are mentioned: the eye and so on are the basis of consciousness and are form.

original: de la de dag rnams kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten nyid kyis ni mig la sogs pa rnams phan tshun las rnam par gcod de /üîΩgzugs kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten mig khon yin gyi /
analyzed: de la de dag rnams kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten nyid kyis ni mig la sogs pa rnams phan tshun las rnam par gcod de / gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten mig khon yin gyi /
translated: Among them, the eye and so on are mutually distinguished by the fact that they are the basis of consciousness.

original: rna ba la sogs pa rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa rnams ma yin no //
translated: The eye is the basis of visual consciousness alone, not of auditory consciousness and so on.

original: reg bya'i rnam par shes pa'i rten ni lus kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: reg bya'i rnam par shes pa'i rten ni lus kho na yin gyi /
translated: The body is the basis of tactile consciousness alone, not of visual consciousness and so on.

original: mig la sogs pa rnams ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar yang de bzhin no //
translated: The other faculties are distinguished from the eye and so on by the fact that they are form.

original: gal te de ltar lnga rnams kyi //
analyzed: gal te de ltar lnga rnams kyi //
translated: If the five are the basis of consciousness,

original: de dang lhan cig skyes pa'ang yin //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig skyes pa'ang yin //
translated: and it is also co-arisen with it.

original: zhes 'byung bas yid kyang mig la sogs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas yid kyang mig la sogs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the mental faculty would also be the eye, etc.

original: de yang de'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de yang de'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is the support of that consciousness.

original: de'i phyir gzugs dang ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs dang ba zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is called the clear form.

original: de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid can gang dag yin pa de dag ni mig la sogs pa rnams kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid can gang dag yin pa de dag ni mig la sogs pa rnams kho na yin gyi /
translated: The eye, etc. are the supports of the consciousnesses that perceive the clear form.

original: yid ma yin no zhes shes par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid ma yin no zhes shes par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The mental faculty is not.

original: yang na mig la sogs pa 'di dag smos pa gang dag yin pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yang na mig la sogs pa 'di dag smos pa gang dag yin pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: Or, the meaning of the phrase ‚Äúthose that are called‚Äù is as follows.

original: de dag gi sgra ni dang po rnams kho na dang 'brel gyi /
analyzed: de dag gi sgra ni dang po rnams kho na dang 'brel gyi /
translated: The word ‚Äúthose‚Äù refers only to the first terms,

original: don dag dang ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dag dang ni ma yin te /
translated: not to the meanings.

original: ji ltar mig la sogs pa rnams chod pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar mig la sogs pa rnams chod pa yin /
translated: How are the eye, etc. obstructed?

original: yang shugs kyis de dag gi sgra dang 'brel pa ltar /
analyzed: yang shugs kyis de dag gi sgra dang 'brel pa ltar /
translated: Just as the word ‚Äúthose‚Äù refers to the first terms by implication,

original: khyod bzhin autpal sngo 'dab lta'i mig can //
analyzed: khyod bzhin autpal sngo 'dab lta'i mig can //
translated: you have eyes like blue lotuses.

original: de yi ze'u 'bru dang mtshungs dri ldan 'di'i //
analyzed: de yi ze'u 'bru dang mtshungs dri ldan 'di'i //
translated: This is the one with a fragrance like its stamen.

original: zhes chod pa dang yang 'brel par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes chod pa dang yang 'brel par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is seen to connect with the word ‚Äúfragrance.‚Äù

original: shugs ni 'dir gsung rab las mig gi rnam par shes pa /
analyzed: shugs ni 'dir gsung rab las mig gi rnam par shes pa /
translated: The word ‚Äúforce‚Äù is used here because the scriptures teach that the eye consciousness,

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes dbang po dag gis rnam par shes pa ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes dbang po dag gis rnam par shes pa ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the ear consciousness, etc., are the consciousnesses of the sense organs.

original: de lta na ni rnam par shes pa rnams ma 'dres par bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni rnam par shes pa rnams ma 'dres par bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the consciousnesses are taught without confusion.

original: yul dag gis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yul dag gis ni ma yin te /
translated: But the objects are not,

original: der mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the eye consciousness, etc., are not distinguished from the mental consciousness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: de ltar bshad na rab tu byed pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de ltar bshad na rab tu byed pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: the author of the commentary says, ‚ÄúThus it is said.‚Äù

original: gzugs kyi phung po rdzas bcu gcig pa bstan pa las dbang po rnams bshad par byas zin to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po rdzas bcu gcig pa bstan pa las dbang po rnams bshad par byas zin to //

original: de'i mjug thogs su de dag gi don rnams bshad par bya dgos te /
analyzed: de'i mjug thogs su de dag gi don rnams bshad par bya dgos te /
translated: Immediately after that, the meanings of those [sense organs] must be explained.

original: de'i phyir / dbang po rnams @27b bshad zin to //
analyzed: de'i phyir / dbang po rnams @27b bshad zin to //
translated: Therefore, the faculties have been explained.

original: don lnga bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: don lnga bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The five objects will now be explained.

original: de la je gzugs bshad par bya dgos pas re zhig gi sgra ni go rims kyi don to //
analyzed: de la je gzugs bshad par bya dgos pas re zhig gi sgra ni go rims kyi don to //
translated: Since form must be explained, the word ‚Äúfirst‚Äù has the sense of sequence.

original: gzugs rnam gnyis dang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis dang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs rnam gnyis dang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis dang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúTwo kinds of form‚Äù means two kinds.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag ni mig la sogs pa dbang po'i yul dag go zhes 'jig rten na rab tu grags pas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag ni mig la sogs pa dbang po'i yul dag go zhes 'jig rten na rab tu grags pas /
translated: Form and so on are well known in the world as the objects of the faculties such as the eye.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid ma brjod par de dag gi dbye ba kho na ston to //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid ma brjod par de dag gi dbye ba kho na ston to //
translated: Therefore, their characteristics are not mentioned, and only their divisions are taught.

original: de ni 'jig rten na grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten na grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are well known in the world.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra ni ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po sdud do //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra ni ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po sdud do //
translated: The word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in ‚Äúblue and so on‚Äù includes yellow, red, and white.

original: gzhan dag ni de'i bye brag go zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i bdog gi bye brag ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni de'i bye brag go zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i bdog gi bye brag ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe others are its varieties‚Äù means the varieties of blue and so on.

original: de dag kyang gang dag ce na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang dag ce na /
translated: What are they?

original: sprin dang / du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang / grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / snang ba dang / mun pa'o //
analyzed: sprin dang / du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang / grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / snang ba dang / mun pa'o //
translated: cloud, smoke, dust, mist, shadow, sunshine, light, darkness.

original: de ltar byas nas kha dog rnam pa bcu gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar byas nas kha dog rnam pa bcu gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, there are twelve colors.

original: rtsa ba'i kha dog bzhi dang / de dag shas che ba dang / shas chung ba dang 'brel pa'i bye brag gis sprin la sogs pa brgyad do //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i kha dog bzhi dang / de dag shas che ba dang / shas chung ba dang 'brel pa'i bye brag gis sprin la sogs pa brgyad do //
translated: The four primary colors and the eight secondary colors, such as cloud, etc., which are distinguished by the predominance or non-predominance of the primary colors.

original: kha cig na re nam mkha'i khams kyi bye brag kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: kha cig na re nam mkha'i khams kyi bye brag kho na yin gyi /
translated: Some say that these are only varieties of the element of space,

original: kha dog gzhan ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: kha dog gzhan ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: and not separate colors.

original: grib ma dang mun ba'i 'od la gnod pa byas pas skyed pa'o //
analyzed: grib ma dang mun ba'i 'od la gnod pa byas pas skyed pa'o //
translated: Shadow and sunshine are produced by the obstruction of light.

original: 'dir khyad bar ni 'di yin te ;
analyzed: 'dir khyad bar ni 'di yin te ;
translated: The difference is this:

original: grib ma ni gang na gzugs rnams snang ba'o //
analyzed: grib ma ni gang na gzugs rnams snang ba'o //
translated: shadow is where forms appear.

original: bzlog pa ni mun pa ste /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni mun pa ste /
translated: The opposite is darkness,

original: gang na gzugs rnams mi snang ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang na gzugs rnams mi snang ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: where forms do not appear.

original: rnam par ma phye zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par ma phye zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba ma byas pa'o //
translated: Unclassified means not classified.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched kha dog tu yod la dbyibs spu med pa yang yod do zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang ser po zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched kha dog tu yod la dbyibs spu med pa yang yod do zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang ser po zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //

original: dbyibs su yod la kha dog tu med pa yang yod de /
analyzed: dbyibs su yod la kha dog tu med pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a form base that exists as color but not as shape, such as blue, yellow, red, and white.üîΩThere is a form base that exists as shape but not as color, such as the direction of long, etc.

original: ring po la sogs pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba ni ring po dang / thung du dang / lham pa dang / zlum po dang / mthon po dang / dma' ba dang / phya le ba dang / phya le ba ma yin pa rnams kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: ring po la sogs pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba ni ring po dang / thung du dang / lham pa dang / zlum po dang / mthon po dang / dma' ba dang / phya le ba dang / phya le ba ma yin pa rnams kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: The direction of long, short, square, round, high, low, even, and uneven.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de'i phyir lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be the nature of bodily intimation.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs gnyis kar yod pa yang yod de /
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs gnyis kar yod pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a form base that exists as both color and shape.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched lhag ma'o //
translated: The remaining form bases.üîΩMoreover, that is the direction of long, etc.,

original: yang de ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed ma gtogs pa ring po la sogs pa'i @28a * //
analyzed: yang de ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed ma gtogs pa ring po la sogs pa'i @28a * //
translated: except for bodily intimation.

original: dbyibs dang / sprin dang / du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna'o //
analyzed: dbyibs dang / sprin dang / du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna'o //
translated: shape, cloud, smoke, dust, and mist.

original: gzhan dag na re nyi ma dang snang ba kho na kha dog tu yod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re nyi ma dang snang ba kho na kha dog tu yod kyi /
translated: According to others, only the sun and fire exist as color.

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dkar po dang / grib ma dang / mun pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dkar po dang / grib ma dang / mun pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: Blue, yellow, red, white, shadow, and light are not colors.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'di ltar ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs ma gtogs par sngon po la sogs pa rnams 'dzin pa med kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs ma gtogs par sngon po la sogs pa rnams 'dzin pa med kyi /
translated: Because, apart from shape, such as long, etc., one does not perceive blue, etc.

original: sngon po la sogs pa rnams ring po la sogs par yongs su chad par snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa rnams ring po la sogs par yongs su chad par snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: But one does perceive blue, etc., as long, etc.

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / grib ma dang / mun pa rnams gnyis kar smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / grib ma dang / mun pa rnams gnyis kar smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Blue, yellow, red, white, shadow, and light are mentioned in the verse as being both color and shape.

original: gnyis kar yod pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gnyis kar yod pa yang yod do //
translated: There is also that which is both.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched lhag ma'o zhes gang smras pa la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched lhag ma'o zhes gang smras pa la /
translated: The remaining part of the verse refers to the remaining sense-sphere of visible form.

original: ji ltar na rdzas gcig la gnyis kar yod ce na zhes bya ba ni yod pa bdog pa'i don du khas blangs nas brgal ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na rdzas gcig la gnyis kar yod ce na zhes bya ba ni yod pa bdog pa'i don du khas blangs nas brgal ba'o //
translated: This is an objection based on the assumption that existence means possession.

original: gnyis kar ni rnam pa gnyis kar ro //
analyzed: gnyis kar ni rnam pa gnyis kar ro //
translated: Both means in both ways.

original: 'di ltar rang gi ngo bo tha dad pas ni rdzas tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi ngo bo tha dad pas ni rdzas tha dad pa yin te /
translated: For, substances are different if their natures are different.

original: de'i phyir de la gcig nyid 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la gcig nyid 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, oneness is contradicted in this case.

original: snang ba la sogs pa bzhin du kha dog kho nar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa bzhin du kha dog kho nar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Color alone would be like light, etc.,

original: lus kyi rnam par rig byed ltar dbyibs kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par rig byed ltar dbyibs kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: or shape alone would be like bodily intimation.

original: de la gnyis ka mngon pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la gnyis ka mngon pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because both are manifest in it.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni rdzas gcig la ste ;
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni rdzas gcig la ste ;
translated: In it means in one substance.

original: kha dog la yang dbyibs dang dbyibs la yang kha dog mngon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dog la yang dbyibs dang dbyibs la yang kha dog mngon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both color and shape are manifest in it.

original: yong pa 'di ni shes pa'i don yin gyi yod pa'i don ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yong pa 'di ni shes pa'i don yin gyi yod pa'i don ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is the meaning of existence, not the meaning of possession.

original: 'di skad du gnyis ka yang mngon pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skad du gnyis ka yang mngon pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is what is being said: because both are manifest.

original: gang kha dog kho nar yod la dbyibs su ma yin pa dang / dbyibs kho nar yod kyi kha dog tu ma yin no zhes bshad pa der ni yod pa'i don kho na yin no //
analyzed: gang kha dog kho nar yod la dbyibs su ma yin pa dang / dbyibs kho nar yod kyi kha dog tu ma yin no zhes bshad pa der ni yod pa'i don kho na yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúexists‚Äù in the statement ‚Äúit exists as color but not as shape‚Äù or ‚Äúit exists as shape but not as color‚Äù is the same.

original: 'o na ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed la yang kha dog dang dbyibs su yod pa zhes thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed la yang kha dog dang dbyibs su yod pa zhes thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: But then it follows that bodily informative form also exists as both color and shape,

original: lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyi rang bzhin thal mo sbyar ba la sogs pa dag la yang dmar po la sogs pa'i kha dog mngon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyi rang bzhin thal mo sbyar ba la sogs pa dag la yang dmar po la sogs pa'i kha dog mngon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of bodily informative form, such as the gesture of joining palms in homage, is clearly manifest as the color red, etc.

original: de'i phyir lus kyi rnam par rig byed ni dbyibs kho nar zhes bya ba de dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus kyi rnam par rig byed ni dbyibs kho nar zhes bya ba de dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the statement ‚ÄúBodily informative form exists as shape alone‚Äù would be contradicted.

original: 'di ni mi mthun pa nye bar bkod pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mi mthun pa nye bar bkod pa ste /
translated: This is a case of the opponent‚Äôs position being extended to a similar but different case.

original: der ni thal mo la sogs pa'i dbyibs dge ba'am /üîΩmi dge ba 'am /
analyzed: der ni thal mo la sogs pa'i dbyibs dge ba'am / mi dge ba 'am /
translated: In that case, the shape of the gesture of joining palms in homage, etc.,üîΩwhether virtuous or nonvirtuous or neutral,

original: @28b lung du ma bstan pa la'ang rung ste rgyu mthun pa skye ba yin la /
analyzed: @28b lung du ma bstan pa la'ang rung ste rgyu mthun pa skye ba yin la /
translated: is the cause for the arising of a similar shape.

original: de yang lus kyi rnam par rig byed yin no //
analyzed: de yang lus kyi rnam par rig byed yin no //
translated: And that is bodily informative form.

original: kha dog ni lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: kha dog ni lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin te /
translated: Color is only indeterminate.

original: de'i phyir der kha dog gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi skye mched lhag mas bsdus pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir der kha dog gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi skye mched lhag mas bsdus pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, whatever color there is in that realm is included in the other sense bases of form.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdus pa'i gzhung ste sgra dang sbrel bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdus pa'i gzhung ste sgra dang sbrel bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The sense base of form has been explained. This is the concluding statement, which is connected with the word ‚Äúsound.‚Äù

original: sgra ni rnam pa brgyad yod de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sgra ni rnam pa brgyad yod de zhes bya ba la /
translated: Sound is of eight types.

original: 'dis dngos po rnams sgrogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis dngos po rnams sgrogs par byed pa ste /
translated: It is sound that proclaims things.

original: gcod par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcod par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it cuts off.

original: yang na sgrogs pas na sgra'o //
analyzed: yang na sgrogs pas na sgra'o //
translated: Or, it is sound because it proclaims.

original: bde bar gshegs pa dag na re rna ba'i yul gzugs 'byung ba bzhi las grub bo zhe'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa dag na re rna ba'i yul gzugs 'byung ba bzhi las grub bo zhe'o //
translated: The Sugatas say that the object of the ear is form that is derived from the four great elements.

original: de la zin pa dag ni lus su gtogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: de la zin pa dag ni lus su gtogs pa rnams te /
translated: Among those, the conjoined are those that belong to the body,

original: phan tshun mthun par byed pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba dag gi rten gyi dngos por nye bar gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun mthun par byed pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba dag gi rten gyi dngos por nye bar gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are mutually compatible, and because they are grasped as the basis of the mind and mental factors.

original: de ni mig la sogs pa da ltar byung ba dang tha dad pa rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba dag ste /
analyzed: de ni mig la sogs pa da ltar byung ba dang tha dad pa rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba dag ste /
translated: They are the present eyes and so on that are distinct from the present eyes and so on, and they arise from karmic maturation and enhancement.

original: bzlog pa ni ma zin pa dag go //üîΩde dag gang las rgyu yod pas na zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni ma zin pa dag go // de dag gang las rgyu yod pas na zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: The opposite are not conjoined.üîΩThey arise from the cause of conjoined great elements because they exist due to the cause of the great elements.

original: de la zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cause of conjoined great elements is like this.

original: lag pa dang ngag gi sgra lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lag pa dang ngag gi sgra lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: For example, it is like the sound of hands and speech.

original: gal te ngag gi sgra ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba yang yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te ngag gi sgra ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba yang yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the sound of speech does not arise from the cause of conjoined great elements,

original: dper na tshangs par 'dod par gtogs pa'i sbrul pas smra ba dang / bsam gtan gnyis par skyes pa rnams kyi ngag gi rnam par rig byed lta bu ste /üîΩrnam rig spyod dang bcas dag na //
analyzed: dper na tshangs par 'dod par gtogs pa'i sbrul pas smra ba dang / bsam gtan gnyis par skyes pa rnams kyi ngag gi rnam par rig byed lta bu ste / rnam rig spyod dang bcas dag na //
translated: for example, it is like the speech of Brahma who is born in the desire realm and the indicative form of speech of those born in the second absorption.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúSpeech is accompanied by awareness.‚Äù

original: yod mod kyi /
analyzed: yod mod kyi /
translated: Although that is so,

original: 'di ni nyes pa med de /
analyzed: 'di ni nyes pa med de /
translated: there is no fault here.

original: dpe nyid du nye bar blangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dpe nyid du nye bar blangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is like an example.

original: 'dir lag pa dang ngag gi sgra ni zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu kho na las byung ba kho na yin no zhes nges par gzung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir lag pa dang ngag gi sgra ni zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu kho na las byung ba kho na yin no zhes nges par gzung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the terms ‚Äúhand‚Äù and ‚Äúvoice‚Äù are not ascertained as being only derived from the cause of the appropriated great elements.

original: sems can du ston pa ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi sgra'o //
analyzed: sems can du ston pa ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi sgra'o //
translated: The sound of speech is indicative of sentient beings.üîΩThe other is not indicative of sentient beings.

original: gzhan ni sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang zhig ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi sgra las gzhan pa zin pa ma yin pa'i 'byung ba'i rgyu can rnam pa gnyis char yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan ni sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang zhig ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi sgra las gzhan pa zin pa ma yin pa'i 'byung ba'i rgyu can rnam pa gnyis char yang ngo //
translated: The other is the sound that is not derived from the cause of the appropriated great elements, which is different from the sound of speech.

original: de ltar zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba'i rgyu can gnyis re re zhing sems can du ston pa dang / sems can ma yin par ston pa yin @29a * //
analyzed: de ltar zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba'i rgyu can gnyis re re zhing sems can du ston pa dang / sems can ma yin par ston pa yin @29a * //
translated: Thus, each of the two, derived from the cause of the appropriated and unappropriated great elements, is indicative of sentient beings and not indicative of sentient beings.

original: pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhi yin la /
analyzed: pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhi yin la /
translated: Therefore, there are four types.

original: rnam pa bzhi po yang re re zhing yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i dbye bas rnam pa brgyad yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po yang re re zhing yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i dbye bas rnam pa brgyad yin no //
translated: Each of these four types is divided into two types: agreeable and disagreeable. Thus there are eight types of sound.

original: yid du 'ong ba ni yid dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba ni yid dang mthun pa ste /
translated: Agreeable is that which is in harmony with the mind.

original: mar 'dzin pa dang / phar 'dzin ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mar 'dzin pa dang / phar 'dzin ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the sound of a mother or father.

original: 'dir rgyu'i dbye ba dang / rang gi ngo bo'i dbye bas sgra'i rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir rgyu'i dbye ba dang / rang gi ngo bo'i dbye bas sgra'i rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: Here the definition of sound is taught by way of the division of cause and the division of its own nature.

original: gzhan dag na re zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba'i sgra yang yod de zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba'i sgra yang yod de zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: Others say that there is also sound that arises from the cause of the great elements that are both conjoined and not conjoined.

original: de la lag pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag ni zin pa'o //
analyzed: de la lag pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag ni zin pa'o //
translated: In this regard, the great elements of the hand are conjoined.

original: rdza rnga'i 'byung ba chen po dag ni ma zin pa'o //
analyzed: rdza rnga'i 'byung ba chen po dag ni ma zin pa'o //
translated: The great elements of the drum are not conjoined.

original: lag pa dang rdza rnga phrad pa las 'byung ba gnyis ka la brten nas skyes pa'i phyir zin pa dang / ma zin pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: lag pa dang rdza rnga phrad pa las 'byung ba gnyis ka la brten nas skyes pa'i phyir zin pa dang / ma zin pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: Sound that arises from both conjoined and not conjoined causes is produced from the contact of the hand and the drum.

original: de ni ji ltar kha dog gi rdul phra rab gcig la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ni ji ltar kha dog gi rdul phra rab gcig la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: That is like the case of a single particle of form.üîΩ

original: lag pa dang rdza rnga phrad pa las skyes pa'i sgra'i rdul phra rab ni 'byung ba bzhi tshan gnyis rgyur byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lag pa dang rdza rnga phrad pa las skyes pa'i sgra'i rdul phra rab ni 'byung ba bzhi tshan gnyis rgyur byas pa ma yin te /
translated: For example, a subtle particle of color is not derived from two sets of four primary elements,

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs yin pa'i phyir kha dog gi rdul phra rab bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs yin pa'i phyir kha dog gi rdul phra rab bzhin no //
translated: because it is derived form, like a subtle particle of color that arises from the contact of a hand and a drum.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rdul phra rab rnams ni re re zhing 'byung ba bzhi tshan la brten pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rdul phra rab rnams ni re re zhing 'byung ba bzhi tshan la brten pa'i phyir te /
translated: The subtle particles of derived form each rely on a set of four primary elements,

original: de'i phyir zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba zhig gam yang na ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba zhig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba zhig gam yang na ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba zhig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: because they are derived from primary elements that are either conjoined with the mind or not conjoined with the mind.

original: sgra'i rdul phra rab kyi tshogs spyir ni zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba lta bur mngon no //
analyzed: sgra'i rdul phra rab kyi tshogs spyir ni zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba lta bur mngon no //
translated: In general, the collection of subtle particles of sound is like that which arises from the primary elements that are conjoined with the mind and not conjoined with the mind.

original: ro ni rnam drug ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ro ni rnam drug ces bya ba la /
translated: Taste is of six types.

original: myang bar bya bas na ro ste /
analyzed: myang bar bya bas na ro ste /
translated: Taste is that which is to be tasted.

original: ro myang bar bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ro myang bar bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúto be tasted‚Äù is the object of taste.

original: rang bzhin gyi bye brag khas blangs nas bye brag drug bstan gyi ;
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi bye brag khas blangs nas bye brag drug bstan gyi ;
translated: The six types of taste are taught on the basis of the distinctions of their natures.

original: de dag sbyar ba'i bye brag las ni mtha' yas so //
analyzed: de dag sbyar ba'i bye brag las ni mtha' yas so //
translated: But there are an infinite number of tastes when one considers the distinctions of their combinations.

original: go rims tha dad pa ni de'i yul can gyi rnam par shes pa'i skye ba nges pa med par bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go rims tha dad pa ni de'i yul can gyi rnam par shes pa'i skye ba nges pa med par bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The order in which they are presented is to show that the consciousnesses that have them as their objects arise in an indeterminate order.

original: dri rnam bzhi zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: dri rnam bzhi zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: There are four types of odor.

original: bsnam par bya bas na dri ste /
analyzed: bsnam par bya bas na dri ste /
translated: Odor is that which is smelled.

original: brngub par bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brngub par bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúto be smelled‚Äù is the object of smell.

original: dri zhim pa dang dri nga ba gnyis dri mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rigs las ni dri zhim pa dang / dri nga ba zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis kho na yin no zhes ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dri zhim pa dang dri nga ba gnyis dri mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rigs las ni dri zhim pa dang / dri nga ba zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis kho na yin no zhes ston par byed pa'o //
translated: There are only two types of odor, good and bad, because good and bad are the distinctions of equal and unequal odors.

original: yang bstan bcos las gsum pa dri mnyam pa bshad pa /
analyzed: yang bstan bcos las gsum pa dri mnyam pa bshad pa /
translated: The Treatise declares that the third type of odor is an equal odor.

original: de ni kha cig dri zhim pa'i phyogs su brlan par @29b bya ba la ;
analyzed: de ni kha cig dri zhim pa'i phyogs su brlan par @29b bya ba la ;
translated: Some are moistened in the direction of a pleasant smell,üîΩand some are moistened in the direction of an unpleasant smell.

original: kha cig dri nga ba'i phyogs su brlan par bya ba yin pas rigs las gsum pa yod pa ma yin no //üîΩde la dri mnyam pa ni gang shas mi che ba'o //
analyzed: kha cig dri nga ba'i phyogs su brlan par bya ba yin pas rigs las gsum pa yod pa ma yin no // de la dri mnyam pa ni gang shas mi che ba'o //
translated: Therefore, there is no third type of smell.üîΩEqual smell is that which is not strong.

original: dri mi mnyam pa ni shas che ba'o //
analyzed: dri mi mnyam pa ni shas che ba'o //
translated: Unequal smell is that which is strong.

original: bstan bcos las ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bstan bcos las ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: But the treatise declares:

original: dri mi mnyam pa ni dri zhim pa dang dri nga ba'i bye brag yin pa'i phyir la ;
analyzed: dri mi mnyam pa ni dri zhim pa dang dri nga ba'i bye brag yin pa'i phyir la ;
translated: Unequal smell is distinguished as pleasant and unpleasant.

original: dri mnyam pa ni de gnyis las gzhan pa thun mong ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dri mnyam pa ni de gnyis las gzhan pa thun mong ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Equal smell should be understood as that which is common to both.

original: reg bya bcu gcig bdag nyid do //üîΩzhes pa la /üîΩreg par bya ba yin pas na reg bya'am /üîΩlus kyi dbang pos reg par nus pas na reg bya'o //
analyzed: reg bya bcu gcig bdag nyid do // zhes pa la / reg par bya ba yin pas na reg bya'am / lus kyi dbang pos reg par nus pas na reg bya'o //
translated: Tangible objects have eleven types.üîΩTangible objects are so called because they are touched.üîΩOr, they are tangible objects because they are capable of being touched by the body faculty.

original: gal te gang gis gang la reg pa de la yang des reg pas lus kyi dbang po yang reg byar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gang gis gang la reg pa de la yang des reg pas lus kyi dbang po yang reg byar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If something touches another and that also touches it, then the body faculty would also be a tangible object.

original: lus kyi dbang po ni reg par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po ni reg par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The body faculty is that which touches,

original: reg par bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: reg par bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not that which is touched,

original: mig bzhin no //üîΩmig ni lta ba yin gyi /
analyzed: mig bzhin no // mig ni lta ba yin gyi /
translated: like the eye.

original: blta ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: blta ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The eye sees, but it is not seen.

original: 'jam pa nyid ni mnyen pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jam pa nyid ni mnyen pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Smoothness is softness.

original: 'jam pa kho na 'jam pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'jam pa kho na 'jam pa nyid de /
translated: Smoothness is just smoothness,

original: so so kho na so so nyid yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: so so kho na so so nyid yin pa bzhin no //
translated: like the individual itself is just the individual.

original: nges pa'i tshig ni sbrel bar bya bas na 'jam pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig ni sbrel bar bya bas na 'jam pa'o //
translated: The definition is that which is to be joined, thus it is smooth.

original: mnyen pa ni rud rud po ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: mnyen pa ni rud rud po ma yin pa ste /
translated: Softness is not roughness.

original: sprad par bzod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sprad par bzod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is able to be joined.

original: rtsub pa nyid ni rud rud po'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtsub pa nyid ni rud rud po'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: Roughness is roughness.

original: rtsub pa 'di la yod pas na rtsub pa ste /
analyzed: rtsub pa 'di la yod pas na rtsub pa ste /
translated: Roughness exists in this, thus it is rough,

original: spu can bzhin no //
analyzed: spu can bzhin no //
translated: like one who has body hair.

original: rtsub pa zhes bya ba ni stobs kyi rnam grangs te /üîΩrtsub pa kho na rtsub pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtsub pa zhes bya ba ni stobs kyi rnam grangs te / rtsub pa kho na rtsub pa nyid do //
translated: Roughness is a synonym for strength.üîΩRoughness itself is roughness.

original: rud rud po ni gyong ba ste /
analyzed: rud rud po ni gyong ba ste /
translated: Roughness is not smoothness.

original: 'jam pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jam pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not soft.

original: lci ba nyid ni gang gis na dngos po rnams 'jal bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni dma' bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: lci ba kho na lci ba nyid do //

analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba pa rnams ni gang las srang mda' mtho bar 'gyur ba'o zhe'o //

original: bzlog pa ni yang ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni yang ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Lightness is the opposite of that.

original: gang gis dngos po rnams 'jal bar mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis dngos po rnams 'jal bar mi byed pa ste /

original: 'di yod na dma' bar 'gyur bas yang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di yod na dma' bar 'gyur bas yang ba'o //

original: yang ba kho na yang ba nyid do //üîΩgang ba ni dro bar 'dod par byed pa'o zhes bya ba na gang gis nyam thag pas dro ba 'dod par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: yang ba kho na yang ba nyid do // gang ba ni dro bar 'dod par byed pa'o zhes bya ba na gang gis nyam thag pas dro ba 'dod par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Lightness itself is lightness.üîΩHeat is that which causes desire for warmth.

original: de ni bgrod pas na grang ba ste /
analyzed: de ni bgrod pas na grang ba ste /
translated: Cold is that which causes desire for heat.

original: phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir myur du bgrod par bya ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir myur du bgrod par bya ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because they benefit or harm, they are quickly traversed.

original: @30a * // bkres pa ni zas 'dod par byed pa'o zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: @30a * // bkres pa ni zas 'dod par byed pa'o zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //

original: gal ta sems las byung ba'i chos ni lus kyi dbang po'i yul du ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal ta sems las byung ba'i chos ni lus kyi dbang po'i yul du ma yin no zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir / rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos te /

original: khong pa na zas 'dod pa dang / sgom 'dod pa'i rgyu reg bya'i khyad par zhig 'byung ste /
analyzed: khong pa na zas 'dod pa dang / sgom 'dod pa'i rgyu reg bya'i khyad par zhig 'byung ste /
translated: A special type of contact arises as the cause of the desire for food in the stomach and the desire for meditation.

original: der zas 'dod pa'i rgyu las bkres pa dang / skom 'dod pa'i rgyu las skom pa zhes bya bshad de /
analyzed: der zas 'dod pa'i rgyu las bkres pa dang / skom 'dod pa'i rgyu las skom pa zhes bya bshad de /
translated: Hunger is explained as the desire for food that arises from the cause of the desire for food in the stomach, and thirst is explained as the desire for drink that arises from the cause of the desire for drink in the stomach.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa byas pa'i phyir ro //

original: gal te 'dir rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa brjod par mi 'dod na ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: gal te 'dir rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa brjod par mi 'dod na ni 'di skad du /

analyzed: bkres pa ni zas 'dod par byed pa'o //
translated: Hunger is the desire for food.

original: skom pa ni skom 'dod par byed pa'o zhes mi brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skom pa ni skom 'dod par byed pa'o zhes mi brjod par 'gyur te /

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /

analyzed: bkres pa dang skom pa dag ni zas dang skom 'dod pa dag go zhes de skad brjod par 'gyur ro //

original: de nyid la dpe /
analyzed: de nyid la dpe /

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde ba nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde ba nyid ma yin gyi /

analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu yin pas bde bar bshad do //

original: de bzhin du chos bstan pa la sogs pa dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos bstan pa la sogs pa dag la yang brjod par bya'o //

original: de la gzugs kyi khams na ni bkres pa dang skom pa dag med de /
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi khams na ni bkres pa dang skom pa dag med de /
translated: In the realm of form, there is no hunger or thirst,

original: kham gyi zas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams der skye pa'i phyir dang / lus la gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: kham gyi zas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams der skye pa'i phyir dang / lus la gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro//

analyzed: gzhan du na ni de na yang bkres pa dang skom pa'i sdug bsngal yod par 'gyur ro //

original: yang ba nyid la sogs pa lhag ma rnam pa lnga ni yod do //
analyzed: yang ba nyid la sogs pa lhag ma rnam pa lnga ni yod do //

original: gal te btags pa las byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams kyi dpag bsam shing gi gos ni srang gcig 'jal lo //
analyzed: gal te btags pa las byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams kyi dpag bsam shing gi gos ni srang gcig 'jal lo //

analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi pa rnams kyi ni de'i phyed do //
translated: the garments of the Caturmaharajakas are measured in half of that,

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams kyi ni de'i phyed do //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams kyi ni de'i phyed do //
translated: the garments of the Trayastrimsas are measured in half of that,

analyzed: de ltar phyed phyed phri bas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams kyi dpag bsam shing gi gos ni srang gi bzhi cha'i bcu drug cha 'jal gyi /

original: de yan chad gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyi gos dag ni mi 'jal lo zhes bshad na /
analyzed: de yan chad gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyi gos dag ni mi 'jal lo zhes bshad na /

original: lci ba nyid yod na ji ltar mi 'jal /
analyzed: lci ba nyid yod na ji ltar mi 'jal /

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni sems can gyi lus rnams dang / de'i rten rnams nor bu'i 'od ltar dang ba'i phyir lci ba nyid mi srid do zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni sems can gyi lus rnams dang / de'i rten rnams nor bu'i 'od ltar dang ba'i phyir lci ba nyid mi srid do zhe na /

original: de la btags pa'i bstan bcos gzhung gzugs par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de la btags pa'i bstan bcos gzhung gzugs par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To explain this, the treatise states:

original: gal te de na gos re re nas mi 'jal yang @30b bsags pa dag ni 'jal lo //
analyzed: gal te de na gos re re nas mi 'jal yang @30b bsags pa dag ni 'jal lo //
translated: If one does not weigh each of the garments, one weighs their collection.

original: 'di ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /

original: bsdus pa dang brgyang ba las te /
analyzed: bsdus pa dang brgyang ba las te /
translated: From the fact that they are collected and spread out.

original: ka sha'i me tog gi snal ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ka sha'i me tog gi snal ma bzhin no //

original: ka sha'i me tog gi snal ma bsdus pa dang / brgyang ba dang ldan pa dag la ni tshogs pa dag 'jal gyi re re ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ka sha'i me tog gi snal ma bsdus pa dang / brgyang ba dang ldan pa dag la ni tshogs pa dag 'jal gyi re re ba ma yin no //
translated: The fibers of the ka≈õa plant, when collected and spread out, are weighed in their collection, not one by one.

original: rten yod pa'i phyir yang gzugs kyi khams na lci ba nyid yod do //
analyzed: rten yod pa'i phyir yang gzugs kyi khams na lci ba nyid yod do //
translated: Weight exists in the realm of fine-materiality, for there is support there.

original: gnod par byed pa'i grang ba med kyi /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i grang ba med kyi /

original: phan par byed pa ni yod do lo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phan par byed pa ni yod do lo zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: kha cig na re lo'i sgra ni ting nge 'dzin las tha dad pa'i phan 'dogs par byed pa khas ma blangs par gsal bar bya ba'i don du'o zhe'o //

original: kha cig ni de dag gi ltar na bsam gtan dang po ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gsum gyi bde bas phan 'dogs par byed par mi 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni de dag gi ltar na bsam gtan dang po ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gsum gyi bde bas phan 'dogs par byed par mi 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: Some say: According to this theory, the first meditation would not be beneficial through the pleasure of the three groups of consciousness.

original: gzhan dag ni de na shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya ba'i reg bya'i khyad par las gzhan pa'i reg pa phan 'dogs par byed pa med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni de na shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya ba'i reg bya'i khyad par las gzhan pa'i reg pa phan 'dogs par byed pa med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: There is no other contact that is beneficial there, except for a special contact called pliancy.

original: gang 'di gzugs rnam pa mang po bshad pa zhes bya ba ni skye mched kyi gzugs te /
analyzed: gang 'di gzugs rnam pa mang po bshad pa zhes bya ba ni skye mched kyi gzugs te /

original: gzugs rnam pa gnyis dang rnam pa nyi shu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs rnam pa gnyis dang rnam pa nyi shu zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de la res 'ga' ni rdzas gcig gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /

original: 'dir rdzas kyi sgra ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rigs brjod kyi /
analyzed: 'dir rdzas kyi sgra ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rigs brjod kyi /

original: rdul phra rab kyi rdzas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi rdzas ni ma yin te /

analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni bsags pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the five collections of consciousness have as their object a collection.

original: de'i rnam pa bye brag tu gcod pa zhes bya ba ni kha cig na re yid kyi rnam par shes pas sngon pa ma yin pa bsal na sngon po'i snyam pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa bye brag tu gcod pa zhes bya ba ni kha cig na re yid kyi rnam par shes pas sngon pa ma yin pa bsal na sngon po'i snyam pa ste /

analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar bar bya'o //

analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pas ni yul bye brag tu gcod par mi nus te / rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: The eye consciousness and so on are not able to determine a particular object because they are nonconceptual.
