translated: When the eye consciousness, which has as its cause a single substance, arises with regard to an object that is determined as a particular, without contacting the nature of another substance,

original: de'i rnam pa bye brag tu gcod pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa bye brag tu gcod pa zhes brjod do //
translated: at that time it is said that its aspect is the determination of a particular.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas rdzas gzhan gyi rang gi ngo bos dben pa'i don gcig bzung ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas rdzas gzhan gyi rang gi ngo bos dben pa'i don gcig bzung ste /
translated: The eye consciousness apprehends a single object that is devoid of the nature of another substance.

original: phyi nas rim gyis yid kyi rnam par shes pas de las gzhan pa'i dngos po rnam par gcod pa'i rnam pa'i sgo nas rnam par rtog par byed de /
analyzed: phyi nas rim gyis yid kyi rnam par shes pas de las gzhan pa'i dngos po rnam par gcod pa'i rnam pa'i sgo nas rnam par rtog par byed de /
translated: Later, the mental consciousness discriminates it in the aspect of excluding other things.

original: de'i phyir mig gi rnam pa la yang de'i rnam pa bye btag tu gcod pa mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig gi rnam pa la yang de'i rnam pa bye btag tu gcod pa mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, it is not contradictory to say that the aspect of the eye consciousness is determined as the aspect of that form.

original: @31a * // nye na kha dog dang dbyibs 'dzin pa'i go skabs yod pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: @31a * // nye na kha dog dang dbyibs 'dzin pa'i go skabs yod pa de'i phyir /

original: dper na thag ring po nas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dper na thag ring po nas zhes bya ba smos so //

original: rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la res 'ga' ni rdzas gcig gis rna ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed de /üîΩgang gi tshe 'di ni pa ta ha'i sgra yin gyi /

translated: It should be understood that the ear consciousness and so on are similar. Sometimes one substance generates an ear consciousness.

original: dung gi sgra ni ma yin no zhes de'i rnam pa bye brag tu gcod par 'gyur ba na'o //
analyzed: dung gi sgra ni ma yin no zhes de'i rnam pa bye brag tu gcod par 'gyur ba na'o //

original: res 'ga' ni mang pos te /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni mang pos te /
translated: Sometimes many generate it.

original: gang gi tshe de'i rnam pa bye brag tu mi gcod pa na ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de'i rnam pa bye brag tu mi gcod pa na ste /
translated: When it does not discriminate its aspect.

original: ca co'i sgra dang / glu dbyangs kyi sgra du ma nyan pa'i lta bu'o //
analyzed: ca co'i sgra dang / glu dbyangs kyi sgra du ma nyan pa'i lta bu'o //
translated: the sound of a voice, the sound of singing, etc.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa la ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa la ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the body consciousness,

original: res 'ga' ni gcig gi ste /üîΩgang gi tshe 'di ni grang ba yin gyi /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni gcig gi ste / gang gi tshe 'di ni grang ba yin gyi /
translated: sometimes it is produced by one factor,üîΩwhen one distinguishes the specific characteristics of the tangible:üîΩthis is cold, not hot;

original: dro ba ni ma yin no //üîΩ'jam pa yin gyi /üîΩrtsub pa ni ma yin no zhes de'i rnam pa bye brag tu gcod par 'gyur ba na'o //
analyzed: dro ba ni ma yin no // 'jam pa yin gyi / rtsub pa ni ma yin no zhes de'i rnam pa bye brag tu gcod par 'gyur ba na'o //
translated: this is smooth, not rough.

original: res 'ga' ni gnyis kyis te /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni gnyis kyis te /
translated: Sometimes it is produced by two factors,

original: 'byung ba gnyis sam 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba gnyis so ;
analyzed: 'byung ba gnyis sam 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba gnyis so ;
translated: two primary elements or two derived matter.

original: / yang res 'ga' ni gsum dang / bzhi nas lnga'i bar gyis te /
analyzed: / yang res 'ga' ni gsum dang / bzhi nas lnga'i bar gyis te /
translated: Sometimes it is produced by three, four, or five factors,

original: 'byung ba rnams dang 'jam pa la sogs pa gcig gis te /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams dang 'jam pa la sogs pa gcig gis te /
translated: when the primary elements are present, and one of the following: smoothness, etc.

analyzed: rtsub pa nyid la sogs pa rnams ni 'byung ba bzhi tshan gzhan la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: , roughness, etc. , being supported on another group of four primary elements.

analyzed: gzhan dag na re bcu gcig pa thams cad kyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dir yang shin tu mang na zhes bya ba bsnyegs te /
translated: Others say: Even the eleven sense faculties such as the eye sense faculty and so on are extremely many.

original: lci ba dang / grang ba dang / rtsub pa pa'i ngo bo nye bar gzung nas bye brag tu ma gcad par 'dzin par mthong ba yang yin no //
analyzed: lci ba dang / grang ba dang / rtsub pa pa'i ngo bo nye bar gzung nas bye brag tu ma gcad par 'dzin par mthong ba yang yin no //
translated: They are seen to apprehend the general nature of heavy, light, cold, hot, rough and smooth without differentiating them.

original: de'i phyir drug dang / bdun dang / bcu gcig gi bar dag gis kyang rkyal chen lto bkug pa rnams la lus kyi rnam par shes pa reg bya bcu gcig gi yul can rnam pa bye brag du ma bcad pa skye ba yin no //

translated: Therefore, even the six, seven and eleven sense faculties generate the body consciousness that is the domain of the eleven types of tactile objects in the belly of a pregnant woman without differentiating their aspects.

original: de lta na spyi la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de lta na spyi la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, because it focuses on the general,

original: chos mngon pa las rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du 'don te /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du 'don te /
translated: the Abhidharma lists the five collections of consciousness as having specific objects.

original: de'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa spyi la dmigs pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyi spyi'i gzugs nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa de'i rnam pa 'dzin pa'i phyir /üîΩspyi'i yul can nyid du 'gyur ro zhes rtsod pa byed do //üîΩgzhan dag ni 'di la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni spyi'i yul can yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa spyi la dmigs pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyi spyi'i gzugs nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa de'i rnam pa 'dzin pa'i phyir / spyi'i yul can nyid du 'gyur ro zhes rtsod pa byed do // gzhan dag ni 'di la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni spyi'i yul can yin te /
translated: Therefore, because they focus on the universal aspect of blue and so on, they are said to be the universal object of form and so on.

original: rang gi yul mtha' dag la @31b dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi yul mtha' dag la @31b dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Others say: The fivefold collection of consciousness is the universal object because it focuses on all its objects.

original: chos thams cad bdag med par shes pa bzhin no zhes sbyor ba nyid byed do //üîΩde'i phyir / 'di dag ni skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med par shes pa bzhin no zhes sbyor ba nyid byed do // de'i phyir / 'di dag ni skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: It is like knowing all phenomena are selfless.üîΩTherefore the Abhidharmako≈õa states, These are the specific characteristics of the sense bases.

original: bstan bcos las ni skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du bshad la /
analyzed: bstan bcos las ni skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du bshad la /
translated: The treatise explains that they are the object of the specific characteristics of the sense bases.

original: skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang sngon po dang ring po la sogs pa rnams kyi spyi'i yin pas spyi'i yul can nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang sngon po dang ring po la sogs pa rnams kyi spyi'i yin pas spyi'i yul can nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur te /
translated: Also, the intrinsic identity of the sense bases is the universal of blue, long, etc., so you accept that they have universal objects.

original: de'i phyir grub pa la sgrub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir grub pa la sgrub bo //
translated: Therefore, you are proving what is already established.

original: rang gi skye mched kyi rdzas du mas bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rang gi skye mched kyi rdzas du mas bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because they are produced by many substances of their own sense bases,

original: spyir khyad par med pa'i bye brag tu ma bcad par de dag la yul du yod pas spyi'i yul can yin gyi /
analyzed: spyir khyad par med pa'i bye brag tu ma bcad par de dag la yul du yod pas spyi'i yul can yin gyi /
translated: they are universal objects because they exist as objects without distinguishing their particulars, which are not universals.

original: gzugs nyid la sogs pa'i spyi nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs nyid la sogs pa'i spyi nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: But they are not universals such as form itself,

original: de ni btags par yod pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni rdzas su yod pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni btags par yod pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni rdzas su yod pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are imputedly existent and because the five collections of consciousness focus on substantially existent objects.

original: gzhan du ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi shes pa yang spyi'i yul can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi shes pa yang spyi'i yul can du 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, consciousness of the intrinsic identity of blue, etc., would be a universal object,

original: rdul phra rab kyi rdzas du mas bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi rdzas du mas bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is produced by many substances of subtle particles.

original: yang skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid gang zhig yin la /
analyzed: yang skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid gang zhig yin la /
translated: What is the intrinsic identity of the sense bases?

original: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the intrinsic identity of substance?

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i rten dang dmigs par rung ba ni ci rigs par mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i rten dang dmigs par rung ba ni ci rigs par mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The intrinsic identity of the sense bases such as the eye is the suitability of the sense bases such as form to be the support and object of eye consciousness and so on, along with their associates.

original: de la mig gi dbang po'i yul kho na la mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'i /
analyzed: de la mig gi dbang po'i yul kho na la mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'i /
translated: The eye consciousness arises only in relation to the object of the eye faculty,

original: gzhan la ni ma yin pas 'di dag ni skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid la skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan la ni ma yin pas 'di dag ni skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid la skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin gyi /
translated: but not in relation to others. Thus the sense bases are the intrinsic identity of the sense bases, and the sense bases are the object of the intrinsic identity of the sense bases.

original: tha dad pa dag la tha mi dad pa btags pa las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa dag la tha mi dad pa btags pa las ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not imputed to be undifferentiated in relation to differentiated objects.

original: de dag ni rnam par rtog pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par rtog pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are nonconceptual.

original: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo thun mong ma yin pa /
analyzed: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo thun mong ma yin pa /
translated: The intrinsic identity of substance is the uncommon intrinsic reality of blue, etc.,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas shes par bya'o //
translated: which is to be known by eye consciousness, etc.

original: gal te rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du 'dod na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du 'dod na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is asserted that the object of the intrinsic identity of substance is a composite, what is the error?

original: bsdus pa la dmigs pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi skye bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: bsdus pa la dmigs pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi skye bar 'gyur na /
translated: Eye consciousness, etc., which have a composite as their object would not arise.

original: de skye ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de skye ba yang yin no //
translated: But they do arise.

original: 'di dpyad par bya ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung @32a * //
analyzed: 'di dpyad par bya ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung @32a * //
translated: This should be investigated.

original: ste ; lus dang lce'i dbang po gnyis ni rten gcig pa'i phyir dang / phrad nas 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / ro dang reg bya dag kyang phan tshun tha dad pa med pa'i phyir yul dang phrad pa'i go rims las rnam par shes pa skye ba'i go rims mi srid pa ste /
analyzed: ste ; lus dang lce'i dbang po gnyis ni rten gcig pa'i phyir dang / phrad nas 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / ro dang reg bya dag kyang phan tshun tha dad pa med pa'i phyir yul dang phrad pa'i go rims las rnam par shes pa skye ba'i go rims mi srid pa ste /
translated: The order of the arising of consciousness is not possible from the order of contact with the object, because the two organs of body and tongue have the same support, because they apprehend after contact, and because there is no mutual difference between taste and tactility.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa lngar gang skye ba dpyad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa lngar gang skye ba dpyad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the five consciousnesses are investigated.

original: gang gi yul shas che ba'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //üîΩza bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang gi yul shas che ba'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo // za bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The five consciousnesses are born in dependence on the predominance of the object.üîΩThe five consciousnesses are born in dependence on the predominance of desire.

original: za bar 'dod pa ni 'dun pa yin la /
analyzed: za bar 'dod pa ni 'dun pa yin la /
translated: Desire is the wish to eat.

original: de yang yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin zhing /üîΩyid la byed pa'i dbang gis kyang sems kyi rgyu dmigs pa gzhan rnams la 'jug pas lce'i rnam par shes pa lngar skye'o //üîΩgang gi tshe yul mnyam pa dang phrad pa la bza' bar 'dod pa med pa de'i tshe ni gang gi rten g-yeng ba de lngar skye'o //
analyzed: de yang yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin zhing / yid la byed pa'i dbang gis kyang sems kyi rgyu dmigs pa gzhan rnams la 'jug pas lce'i rnam par shes pa lngar skye'o // gang gi tshe yul mnyam pa dang phrad pa la bza' bar 'dod pa med pa de'i tshe ni gang gi rten g-yeng ba de lngar skye'o //
translated: And this is associated with attention.üîΩAnd the mind is directed to other objects by the power of attention.üîΩBut when one does not wish to eat when the object is present, then the five consciousnesses are born in dependence on the predominance of distraction of the basis.

original: dbang po lnga'i don dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbang po lnga'i don dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The five consciousnesses are born in dependence on the predominance of the object of the five sense faculties.

original: dbang po lnga po rnams kyi don dag ni dbang po lnga'i don to //
analyzed: dbang po lnga po rnams kyi don dag ni dbang po lnga'i don to //
translated: The objects of the five sense faculties are the objects of the five sense faculties.

original: de dag ji ltar 'dzin pa ni res 'ga' ni rdzas gcig gis mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed de zhes rgyas par ro //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar 'dzin pa ni res 'ga' ni rdzas gcig gis mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed de zhes rgyas par ro //
translated: How are they apprehended? Sometimes one substance generates eye consciousness, and so on in detail.

original: de ni de dag gi mjug thogs su bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni de dag gi mjug thogs su bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that immediately after those,

original: de dag gi bshad pa'i mjug thogs su rnam par rig byed ma yin pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi bshad pa'i mjug thogs su rnam par rig byed ma yin pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: immediately after the explanation of those, nonindicative form should be mentioned.

original: g-yengs dang sems med pa yi yang //
analyzed: g-yengs dang sems med pa yi yang //
translated: Also for those who are distracted and mindless.

original: zhes bya ba ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed las khyad par du byed pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed las khyad par du byed pa ste /
translated: This is to distinguish it from verbal indicative form.

original: ngag gi rnam par rig byed ni sems med pa dang / gzhan gyi sems dang ldan pa la mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: ngag gi rnam par rig byed ni sems med pa dang / gzhan gyi sems dang ldan pa la mi 'byung ste /
translated: Verbal indicative form does not occur for those without mind or for those with other minds

original: rgyun chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is interrupted.

original: rjes 'brel gang zhes bya ba ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed las khyad par du byed pa'o //
analyzed: rjes 'brel gang zhes bya ba ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed las khyad par du byed pa'o //
translated: What is its continuum? This is to distinguish it from physical indicative form.

original: gal te rnam par rig byed kyang rjes su 'brel pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rig byed kyang rjes su 'brel pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If physical indicative form is also a continuum,

original: rnam par rig byed log kyang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa mi ldog pa'i phyir 'dir mchog tu gyur par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed log kyang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa mi ldog pa'i phyir 'dir mchog tu gyur par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is the best of all because even when the indicative form is absent, the nonindicative form is not absent.

original: dge dang mi dge zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rgyun las khyad par du byed pa'o //üîΩ'byung ba cher rnams rgyur byas pa //
analyzed: dge dang mi dge zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rgyun las khyad par du byed pa'o // 'byung ba cher rnams rgyur byas pa //
translated: ‚ÄúVirtue and nonvirtue‚Äù is a specification of the continuum of the eye, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i rgyun las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i rgyun las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúDerived from the great elements‚Äù is a specification of the continuum of the obtainment.

original: de las gzhan pa'i sems kyi yang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sems kyi yang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúOr other‚Äù refers to the mind.

original: 'dir de'i sgras ni kun nas slong ba'i sems tsam zhig brjod par 'dod la /
analyzed: 'dir de'i sgras ni kun nas slong ba'i sems tsam zhig brjod par 'dod la /
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúthat‚Äù is intended to refer to the motivating mind alone.

original: de la gzhan ni de slong bar byed pa'i sems dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: de la gzhan ni de slong bar byed pa'i sems dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yang rung ste /
translated: In that context, ‚Äúother‚Äù refers to the mind that motivates it, which is either virtuous or neutral, since it is not similar to the motivating mind.

original: rjes su 'jug par byed pa @32b g-yengs ba thams cad la brjod kyi /
analyzed: rjes su 'jug par byed pa @32b g-yengs ba thams cad la brjod kyi /
translated: It is said that all distracted minds that engage in it are also nonindicative form.

original: nyon mongs pa can kho na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can kho na ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not only the afflicted mind.

original: gnyid dang brgyal ba sems med par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang / 'du shes med pa pa la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyid dang brgyal ba sems med par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang / 'du shes med pa pa la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not accepted that sleep and fainting are mindless states, and because beings devoid of discernment do not have nonindicative form.

original: 'du shes med pa dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i yang yin pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i yang yin pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúAlso, those who are absorbed in the meditative attainment of nondiscernment and the meditative attainment of cessation.‚Äù

original: sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis kho na yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis kho na yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: This indicates that there are only two meditative attainments that are mindless states.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgra gang zhig tshig le'ur byas pa las /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgra gang zhig tshig le'ur byas pa las /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the root text indicates that the root text‚Äôs statement,

original: g-yengs dang sems med pa yi yang //
analyzed: g-yengs dang sems med pa yi yang //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso, those who are distracted and those who are mindless,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ste /üîΩma g-yengs pa sems dang bcas pa'i yang yin no zhes bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste / ma g-yengs pa sems dang bcas pa'i yang yin no zhes bya bar mngon no //
translated: is a reference to the verse that states:üîΩ‚ÄúAlso, those who are distracted and those who are mindless.‚ÄùüîΩThe phrase ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the verse indicates that there are also those who are not distracted and who possess minds.

original: 'dir yang sems bcas pa smos pa ni 'di sems g-yengs pa med pas na sems ma g-yengs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang sems bcas pa smos pa ni 'di sems g-yengs pa med pas na sems ma g-yengs pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose who possess minds‚Äù in the root text is stated in this context to indicate that those who are not distracted are those who are not mentally disturbed.

original: sems g-yengs pa bkag pa'i phyir dang / mi g-yeng ba mngon du gyur pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang na sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sems g-yengs pa bkag pa'i phyir dang / mi g-yeng ba mngon du gyur pa'i phyir ro // yang na sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: because it stops the distracted mind and because it manifests the undistracted mind.

original: g-yengs pa'i sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs dang / ma g-yengs pa'i sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: g-yengs pa'i sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs dang / ma g-yengs pa'i sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Or else, the two states are the state of having a distracted mind and the state of having an undistracted mind.

original: de la g-yengs pa sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs ni dngos su bstan la /
analyzed: de la g-yengs pa sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs ni dngos su bstan la /
translated: The state of having a distracted mind is directly taught,

original: ma g-yengs sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs ming gi sgras so //
analyzed: ma g-yengs sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs ming gi sgras so //
translated: and the state of having an undistracted mind is taught by implication.

original: de lta yin dang sems dang sems med pa yang zhes bya ba 'dis gnas skabs gsum bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang sems dang sems med pa yang zhes bya ba 'dis gnas skabs gsum bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then this passage teaches three states:

original: rjes 'brel gang zhes bya ba ni rgyun no //üîΩgal te skad cig dang po la rjes su 'brel pa med pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: rjes 'brel gang zhes bya ba ni rgyun no // gal te skad cig dang po la rjes su 'brel pa med pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin pa med do zhe na /
translated: ‚Äúthat which is connected‚Äù means a continuum.üîΩIf you say that in the first moment there is no nonindicative form because there is no connection,

original: skad cig dang po yang skad cig phyi ma la ltos nas rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig dang po yang skad cig phyi ma la ltos nas rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then the first moment would not exist because it is dependent on the later moments.

original: gal te rnam par rig byed ma yin pa rjes su 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid can yin la /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rig byed ma yin pa rjes su 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid can yin la /
translated: If you say that noninformative form is characterized by being related,

original: rjes su 'brel pa yang rgyun yin pa'i phyir btags par yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su 'brel pa yang rgyun yin pa'i phyir btags par yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: and that being related is a continuum, then it would be imputedly existent.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gzugs kyi mtshan nyid can yin pa na rgyun te /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gzugs kyi mtshan nyid can yin pa na rgyun te /
translated: If noninformative form is characterized by form, it is a continuum.

original: rgyun chags pa yin la /
analyzed: rgyun chags pa yin la /
translated: It is a continuous series.

original: rgyun can dag kyang yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyun can dag kyang yod pa yin gyi /
translated: The members of that continuum exist.

original: der rgyun tsam zhig kho na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: der rgyun tsam zhig kho na ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not just a mere continuum.

original: gal te de ltar rjes 'brel zhes ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar rjes 'brel zhes ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
translated: If that is so, why is it called related?

original: rnam par rig byed 'phen par byed pa'i 'byung ba 'gags kyang ma btang gi bar du rjes su 'jug par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed 'phen par byed pa'i 'byung ba 'gags kyang ma btang gi bar du rjes su 'jug par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is to be understood that even though the primary elements that propel the informative form have ceased, the noninformative form continues until it is relinquished.

original: thob pa'i rgyun yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa @33a * //
analyzed: thob pa'i rgyun yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa @33a * //
translated: The continuum of attainment, etc.

original: la ; thob pa rnams ni mi ldan pa yin pa'i phyir 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: la ; thob pa rnams ni mi ldan pa yin pa'i phyir 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa ma yin no //
translated: Attainment is not form derived from the four great elements because it is not possessed.

original: 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe great elements are its cause‚Äù means

original: ji ltar bud shing rgyur byas nas me 'byung ba ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar bud shing rgyur byas nas me 'byung ba ltar /
translated: just as fire arises with fuel as its cause,

original: 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa ste /
translated: the great elements are the cause of the non-revealing form.

original: rgyu mtshan du byas pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan du byas pa ste /
translated: They are its reason for being.

original: de ltar byas pa zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: de ltar byas pa zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: It is understood that it is produced in that way.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: rgyur byas pa'i don ni rgyu'i don te zhes smos so //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i don ni rgyu'i don te zhes smos so //
translated: the meaning of ‚Äúcause‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúreason.‚Äù

original: ji ltar 'byung ba chen po rnams 'di'i rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung ba chen po rnams 'di'i rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: How are the great elements the cause of this?

original: de'i phyir / skyed pa la sogs pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir / skyed pa la sogs pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod de /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause it is the nature of the cause of generation and so on.‚Äù

original: bskyed pa dang / rten pa dang / gnas pa dang / rton pa dang / 'phel par byed pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo'i yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde ni rnam par rig byed min zhes bya ba la rgyun de'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa dang / rten pa dang / gnas pa dang / rton pa dang / 'phel par byed pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo'i yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to // de ni rnam par rig byed min zhes bya ba la rgyun de'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is the nature of the cause of generation, support, maintenance, reliance, and growth.üîΩThat is the continuum of non-revealing form.

original: rnam par rig byed min zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed min zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is called non-revealing form.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni rnam par rig byed bkag pa tsam ma yin la /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni rnam par rig byed bkag pa tsam ma yin la /
translated: Nonindicative form is not merely the negation of indicative form.

original: gang cung zad cig rnam par rig byed las gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang cung zad cig rnam par rig byed las gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not something that is in any way other than indicative form.

original: go rims ji lta ba bzhin du rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa dang / bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go rims ji lta ba bzhin du rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa dang / bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, respectively, it would not substantially exist and such things as a pot would become nonindicative form.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: gzugs dang byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed dang 'dra ba'i gzugs gzhan zhig /
analyzed: gzugs dang byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed dang 'dra ba'i gzugs gzhan zhig /
translated: It is another form that is similar to indicative form because it is the intrinsic nature of form and action.

original: rang kun slong bar byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnam par rig byed ma yin pas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rang kun slong bar byed pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnam par rig byed ma yin pas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is nonindicative form because it is the nonindicative form of the mind and mental factors that motivate it.

original: 'dra ba dgag tshig brjod pa'i phyir bram ze ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba dgag tshig brjod pa'i phyir bram ze ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is similar to indicative form because it is called a negation of indicative form, like a nonbrahmin.

original: gzugs dang byed pa'i rang bzhin yin yang zhes bya bas /
analyzed: gzugs dang byed pa'i rang bzhin yin yang zhes bya bas /
translated: Since it is the intrinsic nature of form and action, it is similar to indicative form.

original: gzugs smos pa ni sems pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs smos pa ni sems pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term form is mentioned in order to distinguish it from volition.

original: byed pa smos pa ni mig la sogs pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa smos pa ni mig la sogs pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term action is mentioned in order to distinguish it from the eye, etc.

original: de'i phyir de lta na ni'i sgras 'di shes par byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta na ni'i sgras 'di shes par byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the term thus is understood to refer to that.

original: slob dpon gyi tshig yin par ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni ston pa'i gsung ma yin no snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi tshig yin par ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni ston pa'i gsung ma yin no snyam du dgongs so //
translated: The term of the master is stated means that it is not the statement of the Teacher.

original: yang na brjod ces bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na brjod ces bya ba la /
translated: Or, the term expressed means

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: from what?

original: mdo las te /
analyzed: mdo las te /
translated: From the sutra.

original: rnam gsum dri med gzugs gsungs dang // 'phel dang ma byas lam sogs phyir //
analyzed: rnam gsum dri med gzugs gsungs dang // 'phel dang ma byas lam sogs phyir //
translated: The three are said to be stainless form, because of increase, non-production, path, etc.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained.

original: mdor na rnam par rig byed dang ting nge 'dzin las byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: mdor na rnam par rig byed dang ting nge 'dzin las byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: In brief, the term derived from informative form and concentration is stated.

original: de la dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes ma brjod na ni rnam par rig byed dang / ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i @33b rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / rgyas pa las byung ba dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes ma brjod na ni rnam par rig byed dang / ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i @33b rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / rgyas pa las byung ba dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not stated that form is wholesome or unwholesome, then it would follow that form derived from maturation and form derived from enhancement would be form derived from consciousness and form derived from concentration.

original: rnam par rig byed dang ting nge 'dzin las byung ba ma brjod na ni rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs la yang gzugs thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed dang ting nge 'dzin las byung ba ma brjod na ni rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs la yang gzugs thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not stated that form is derived from consciousness and form is derived from concentration, then it would follow that form that is indicative would be form.

original: de'i phyir gnyis ka smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis ka smos so //
translated: Therefore, both are stated.

original: da la rnam par rig byed la skyes pa ni sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can dge ba dang mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: da la rnam par rig byed la skyes pa ni sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can dge ba dang mi dge ba'o //
translated: Here, form derived from consciousness is wholesome or unwholesome, having the nature of vows and nonvows.

original: ting nge 'dzin las byung ba ni dge ba kho na ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las byung ba ni dge ba kho na ste /
translated: Form derived from concentration is only wholesome.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: Nonindicative form is the nature of the vows of meditative absorption and uncontaminated vows.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: rig byed sogs stobs kyis drangs shing //
analyzed: rig byed sogs stobs kyis drangs shing //
translated: It is drawn by the power of indication and so on.

original: dge dang mi dge'i rjes 'brel gang //
analyzed: dge dang mi dge'i rjes 'brel gang //
translated: What is the result of good and bad actions?

original: dge slong byed gzugs can de //
analyzed: dge slong byed gzugs can de //
translated: The monk is the form of the action.

original: rnam rig byed min gos pa'o //
analyzed: rnam rig byed min gos pa'o //
translated: It is covered by the non-indicative.üîΩThe elements are the earth element, etc.

original: 'byung ba dag ni sa khams dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dang po dang mthar khams smos pa ni bar du yang de shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba dag ni sa khams dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dang po dang mthar khams smos pa ni bar du yang de shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of the elements at the beginning and end is to make known the middle.

original: khams smos pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid kyi sa la sogs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir te //
analyzed: khams smos pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid kyi sa la sogs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir te //
translated: The mention of the elements is to exclude earth, etc. which have the nature of color and shape.

original: gzhan du bshad na ni de dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du bshad na ni de dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were explained otherwise, it would follow that they are also elements.

original: sa nyid khams yin pa ni sa'i khams te /
analyzed: sa nyid khams yin pa ni sa'i khams te /
translated: Earth itself is the earth element.

original: lhag ma dag la yang de skad du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma dag la yang de skad du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the rest.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i phyir khams dag go zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis te ;
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i phyir khams dag go zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis te ;
translated: They are elements because they hold their own characteristics and form that is derived. This is according to the method of etymology.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni sra ba dang / gsher ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni sra ba dang / gsher ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Their own characteristics are solidity, fluidity, etc.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni 'byung ba dag las gzhan pa'i gzugs thams cad do //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni 'byung ba dag las gzhan pa'i gzugs thams cad do //
translated: Derivative form is all form other than the primary elements.

original: gzhan dag ni gzugs thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin pas na 'byung gnas dag go //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gzugs thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin pas na 'byung gnas dag go //
translated: The primary elements are called sources because they are the sources of all form.

original: 'byung ba rnams kyang 'byung ba rnams kyi 'byung gnas yin te ;
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams kyang 'byung ba rnams kyi 'byung gnas yin te ;
translated: The primary elements are also the sources of the primary elements themselves.

original: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are homogeneous causes of each other.

original: 'jig rten na 'byung gnas dag la khams kyi ming 'dogs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na 'byung gnas dag la khams kyi ming 'dogs te /
translated: In the world, sources are called elements.

original: zangs kyi 'byung khungs bzhin no //
analyzed: zangs kyi 'byung khungs bzhin no //
translated: For example, copper, iron, etc.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The four great elements are the source of all form.

original: yang ji ltar 'di dag chen po nyid dang / 'byung ba nyid dang / bzhi nyid yin zhe na /üîΩ'di dag gzugs gzhan thams cad kyi rten nyid du rags pa'i phyir na chen po nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang ji ltar 'di dag chen po nyid dang / 'byung ba nyid dang / bzhi nyid yin zhe na / 'di dag gzugs gzhan thams cad kyi rten nyid du rags pa'i phyir na chen po nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: How are they great, primary, and four?üîΩThey are great because they are the basis of all other form.

original: gang zhig 'byung ba dag las gzhan pa'i gzugs de'i rten nyid du rigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang zhig 'byung ba dag las gzhan pa'i gzugs de'i rten nyid du rigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are the basis of form that is other than the primary elements themselves.

original: gtos che zhes bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gtos che zhes bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because they are the most extensive.

original: yang nas dang chu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩ'byung @34a * //
analyzed: yang nas dang chu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / 'byung @34a * //
translated: Again, earth, water, fire, and wind are the heaps of earth, water, fire, and wind.üîΩThe elements are the four great elements.

original: ba de dag gi bya ba shas che ba gang dag la yod pas la sogs pa'i phung po de dag ni de dag gi bya ba shas che ba dag go //
analyzed: ba de dag gi bya ba shas che ba gang dag la yod pas la sogs pa'i phung po de dag ni de dag gi bya ba shas che ba dag go //
translated: Those heaps that are the most extensive in the activity of the elements are the heaps of earth, etc.

original: bya ba ni 'dzin pa la sogs pa las so /
analyzed: bya ba ni 'dzin pa la sogs pa las so /
translated: Activity is the function of grasping, etc.

original: shas che ba nyid ni mtshan nyid rgyas pa las de dag mngon par gsal ba'o //
analyzed: shas che ba nyid ni mtshan nyid rgyas pa las de dag mngon par gsal ba'o //
translated: The most extensive is the manifest of those through the extensive characteristics.

original: sa la sogs pa'i phung po dag ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid can dag go //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i phung po dag ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid can dag go //
translated: The heaps of earth, etc. are of the nature of color and shape.

original: chen por gnas pa nyid ni rgya chen por gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: chen por gnas pa nyid ni rgya chen por gnas pa nyid do //
translated: The state of greatness is the state of being extensive.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i tshigs pa thams cad la sra ba la sogs pa yod pas na de dag ni chen po nyid de /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i tshigs pa thams cad la sra ba la sogs pa yod pas na de dag ni chen po nyid de /
translated: Since solidity, etc. exist in all the aggregates of form, etc. they are the great elements.

original: gzugs kyi khams na dri dang ro gnyis med la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na dri dang ro gnyis med la /
translated: In the form realm, both smell and taste do not exist.

original: sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyang de la tshogs pa rnams la phan tshun med pa de ltar sra ba la sogs pa rnams 'gar yang med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyang de la tshogs pa rnams la phan tshun med pa de ltar sra ba la sogs pa rnams 'gar yang med pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, solidity, etc. are not absent anywhere.

original: de ltar re zhig chen po nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig chen po nyid yin no //
translated: In this way, the great elements are established.

original: 'byung ba nyid ni gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs mngon par 'grub pa la de dang de dag gi rnam par 'byung bas na 'byung ba dag go //
analyzed: 'byung ba nyid ni gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs mngon par 'grub pa la de dang de dag gi rnam par 'byung bas na 'byung ba dag go //
translated: The elements are so called because they are the origin of the various forms of matter, since they appear in various forms.

original: gzhan dag re 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas sems can thams cad kyi las kyi dbang gis nam yang ma byung ma myong bas ni 'byung ba dag go zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag re 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas sems can thams cad kyi las kyi dbang gis nam yang ma byung ma myong bas ni 'byung ba dag go zhe'o //
translated: Others say: The elements are so called because they have never not existed, since beginningless samsara, through the power of the karma of all sentient beings.

original: yang na 'byung ba nyid 'byung ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo mched par byed pas na 'byung ba dag ste /
analyzed: yang na 'byung ba nyid 'byung ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo mched par byed pas na 'byung ba dag ste /
translated: Or, the elements are so called because they increase the nature of the elements, which is the existence of entities.

original: dngos po'i yod pa dang / sems can gyi skye ba rgyas par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po'i yod pa dang / sems can gyi skye ba rgyas par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they increase the existence of entities and the birth of sentient beings.

original: yang ji ltar 'byung ba chen po dag ni bzhi kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: yang ji ltar 'byung ba chen po dag ni bzhi kho na yin gyi /
translated: Why are the great elements only four?

original: ji ltar phyi rol pa ltar nam mkha' ni ma yin zhes bya ba 'di khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol pa ltar nam mkha' ni ma yin zhes bya ba 'di khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand that space is not like the non-Buddhist schools maintain?

original: nam mkha' ni 'byung ba dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir 'byung ba ma yin la /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni 'byung ba dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir 'byung ba ma yin la /
translated: Space is not an element because it is not homogeneous with the elements.

original: sa la sogs pa ltar dngos po rnams la phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa med pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu sna tshogs pa mi byed pa'i phyir 'byung ba chen po ma yin no //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa ltar dngos po rnams la phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa med pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu sna tshogs pa mi byed pa'i phyir 'byung ba chen po ma yin no //
translated: It is not a great element because it does not benefit or harm like earth, etc., and because it does not produce a variety of effects.

original: sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba dag ni mig la sogs pa 'bras bu sna tshogs par byed par mthong na nam mkha' ni rtag pa dang sna tshogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba dag ni mig la sogs pa 'bras bu sna tshogs par byed par mthong na nam mkha' ni rtag pa dang sna tshogs pa ma yin no //
translated: The elements such as earth are seen to produce a variety of effects such as eyes, etc. But space is not permanent and not a variety.

original: rtag pa dang sna tshogs pa ma yin pa ni rgyu la 'bras bu mi rtag pa dang / sna tshogs pa 'byung bar yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: rtag pa dang sna tshogs pa ma yin pa ni rgyu la 'bras bu mi rtag pa dang / sna tshogs pa 'byung bar yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is not possible for a permanent and non-variety to be the cause of an impermanent and a variety,

original: ji skad du /üîΩdngos po rtag pa las byung ba //
analyzed: ji skad du / dngos po rtag pa las byung ba //
translated: as it is said:üîΩHow could an effect arise from a permanent entity?

original: mi rtag par ni ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: mi rtag par ni ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could an impermanent effect arise from a permanent cause?

original: rgyu 'bras mtshan nyid mi mthun pa //
analyzed: rgyu 'bras mtshan nyid mi mthun pa //
translated: A cause and effect that are not similar in type

original: de ni nam yang mthong ba med //üîΩces bshad do //
analyzed: de ni nam yang mthong ba med // ces bshad do //
translated: are never seen.

original: dngos po rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa'i dus dag tu khyad par med pa'i phyir nam mkha' ni sa la sogs pa ltar 'byung ba chen po ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa'i dus dag tu khyad par med pa'i phyir nam mkha' ni sa la sogs pa ltar 'byung ba chen po ma yin no //
translated: Space is not an element like earth, etc., because it is not distinguished in terms of arising and destruction.

original: @34b sa bon la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi 'byung ba dag ni rnam par 'gyur bar 'gyur ba na myu gu la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi rkyen dag tu mthong na /
analyzed: @34b sa bon la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi 'byung ba dag ni rnam par 'gyur bar 'gyur ba na myu gu la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi rkyen dag tu mthong na /
translated: The elements in the state of a seed, etc., are seen to be conditions in the state of a sprout, etc., when they transform.

original: nam mkha' ni de ltar rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin te rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni de ltar rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin te rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But space is not like that, because it does not transform, since it is permanent.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rgyu ni rnam par 'gyur ba na //
analyzed: rgyu ni rnam par 'gyur ba na //
translated: When a cause transforms,

original: gzhan gyi rgyu ru 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyu ru 'gyur ba ste //
translated: it becomes the cause of another.

original: gang la rnam par 'gyur yod pa'i //
analyzed: gang la rnam par 'gyur yod pa'i //
translated: That which transforms

original: de ni rtag ces bya yod min //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ni rtag ces bya yod min // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: is not said to be permanent.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: nam mkha' ni chen po yin gyi /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni chen po yin gyi /
translated: Space is great.

original: 'byung ba ni yin te 'byung ba ni skyes pa'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni yin te 'byung ba ni skyes pa'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are elements because element is a synonym for origin.

original: ji skad du 'byung ba chen po nyid kyis 'thad pa'i phyir dang / gang yang rung ba zhig ma tshang na 'byung ba las gyur pa skyed par mi nus pa'i phyir ma tshang ba dang lhag ma med par bzhi nyid yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: ji skad du 'byung ba chen po nyid kyis 'thad pa'i phyir dang / gang yang rung ba zhig ma tshang na 'byung ba las gyur pa skyed par mi nus pa'i phyir ma tshang ba dang lhag ma med par bzhi nyid yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúBecause they are established as great elements and because they are four in number without any remainder or excess, since if any one is missing, the derivative form cannot be generated.‚Äù

original: bye brag tu smra ba pa rnams kyi nus pa med pa don med par thal ba'i phyir te /üîΩkhri'u rkang bzhi pa bzhin no zhe na'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba pa rnams kyi nus pa med pa don med par thal ba'i phyir te / khri'u rkang bzhi pa bzhin no zhe na'o //
translated: For the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas, it is meaningless to say they are not capable,

original: yang khams de dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: yang khams de dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: because it would follow that a four legged stool would not be capable of supporting a pot.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bo tsam zhig bstan par bya ba yin bzhin du ci'i phyir sa'i khams la sogs pa'i las brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bo tsam zhig bstan par bya ba yin bzhin du ci'i phyir sa'i khams la sogs pa'i las brjod ce na /
translated: If the nature of the elements is taught, why are the functions of the earth element and so on mentioned?

original: tshogs pa thams cad la de dag gi rnag bzhin ma dmigs kyang las de yod pa nyid du rjes su dpag par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshogs pa thams cad la de dag gi rnag bzhin ma dmigs kyang las de yod pa nyid du rjes su dpag par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The functions of the elements are stated because although the nature of the elements is not observed in all their collections, their function is inferred to exist.

original: chu dag la gru 'debs pas sa yod la /
analyzed: chu dag la gru 'debs pas sa yod la /

translated: Just as it cannot be seen, so too it cannot be touched by contact, etc.

original: yongs su 'gyur ba yang ma yin la thogs pa yang ma yin no snyam du bsam pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba yang ma yin la thogs pa yang ma yin no snyam du bsam pa'o //
translated: It does not transform and it is not impeded.

original: 'di ni rdzas kyi rdul phra rab la mngon par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni rdzas kyi rdul phra rab la mngon par 'dod kyi /
translated: This is the assertion about the subtle particle as a substance.

original: 'dus pa'i rdul phra rab ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dus pa'i rdul phra rab ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not about the subtle particle as an aggregation.

original: de ni rdzas brgyad pa yin pas gzugs su rung ba mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de ni rdzas brgyad pa yin pas gzugs su rung ba mi 'gal lo //
translated: Because that is an aggregation of eight substances, it is not contradictory that it can be form.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: rdul phra rab kyi rdzas gcig pu logs shig tu gyur pa ni med pa nyid do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi rdzas gcig pu logs shig tu gyur pa ni med pa nyid do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said that a single subtle particle as a substance does not exist separately.

original: 'dod na dbang po med pa dang // sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas brgyad //
analyzed: 'dod na dbang po med pa dang // sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas brgyad //
translated: If it is asserted that it is without faculties and sound, then it is an aggregation of eight substances.

original: ces bya ba la sogs par nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs par nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is ascertained in such passages as this.

original: 'dus pa la gnas pa de la ni gzugs su rung ba nyid do ste /
analyzed: 'dus pa la gnas pa de la ni gzugs su rung ba nyid do ste /
translated: But that which abides in an aggregation can be form.

original: yongs su 'gyur ba'am thogs pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba'am thogs pa yin no //
translated: It transforms and it is impeded.

original: 'o na ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: But then, past and future form

original: yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir gnod par byar rung ba ma yin zhing thogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir gnod par byar rung ba ma yin zhing thogs pa ma yin te /
translated: are not suitable to be obstructive, because they do not exist in a place, and they are not impeded.

original: gzugs ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore they are not form.

original: de yang gzugs su yod zin pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'o //üîΩgzugs su yod par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa skye ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: de yang gzugs su yod zin pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'o // gzugs su yod par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa skye ba'i chos can no //
translated: That which has already become form is past.üîΩThat which will become form is future and has the attribute of arising.

original: de dang rigs mthun pa zhes @36b bya ba ni gzugs su yod par gyur pa dang rigs mthun pa mi skye ba'i chos can la 'dod do /
analyzed: de dang rigs mthun pa zhes @36b bya ba ni gzugs su yod par gyur pa dang rigs mthun pa mi skye ba'i chos can la 'dod do /
translated: That which is similar to that is present and has the attribute of not arising.

original: bung shing bzhin no //
analyzed: bung shing bzhin no //
translated: It is like firewood.

original: dper na shing la sogs pa 'bud bzhin pa ma yin pa yang bud shing du brjod do //
analyzed: dper na shing la sogs pa 'bud bzhin pa ma yin pa yang bud shing du brjod do //
translated: For example, even though wood and so on that is not burning is called firewood,üîΩall that is similar to it is firewood because it is similar in type to that which is burning and that which will burn.

original: gang zhig 'bud par 'gyur ba dang / gang zhig 'bud par 'gyur ba ma yin pa de thams cad de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir bud shing yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig 'bud par 'gyur ba dang / gang zhig 'bud par 'gyur ba ma yin pa de thams cad de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir bud shing yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no //
translated: So too, here, that which has already become form and that which will become form are similar in type to that which is present form.

original: 'o na ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gzugs ma yin par 'gyur te /üîΩde dang rigs mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gzugs ma yin par 'gyur te / de dang rigs mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Nonindicative form would not be form because it is not homogeneous with form and it is not impeded.

original: rnam par rig byed kyang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir gzugs dang rigs mthun pa nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed kyang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir gzugs dang rigs mthun pa nyid de /
translated: Nonindicative form is homogeneous with form because it is homogeneous with indicative form.

original: 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is homogeneous with form because it arises from the great elements.

original: de yang rnam par rig byed la gzugs su yod pa'i phyir gzugs su yod par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de yang rnam par rig byed la gzugs su yod pa'i phyir gzugs su yod par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: It is form because it exists as form in indicative form.

original: de kun nas slong bar byed pa lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis rnam par 'gyur bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yang gzugs su yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de kun nas slong bar byed pa lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis rnam par 'gyur bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yang gzugs su yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Nonindicative form also exists as form because it is transformed by the indicative form of body and speech that motivates it and by contact with the hands and so on.

original: 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not form because it is not transformation.

original: rnam par rig byed rnam par 'gyur bzhin du rnam par rig byed ma yin par mi 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed rnam par 'gyur bzhin du rnam par rig byed ma yin par mi 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nonindicative form would not be nonindicative form when indicative form changes because there would be no difference between them.

original: 'di ltar thal mo sbyar ba dang // sgra la sogs par 'gyur ba na //
analyzed: 'di ltar thal mo sbyar ba dang // sgra la sogs par 'gyur ba na //
translated: For example, when one joins the palms together or makes a sound and so on,

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: nonindicative form does not have a difference.

original: shing ljon pa la ni yal ga dang po la sogs pa'i chung ba dang / 'phel ba yin pa dang / grib ma chung ba dang / 'phel bar 'gyur bas shing ljon pa g-yos pas grib ma g-yo ba mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: shing ljon pa la ni yal ga dang po la sogs pa'i chung ba dang / 'phel ba yin pa dang / grib ma chung ba dang / 'phel bar 'gyur bas shing ljon pa g-yos pas grib ma g-yo ba mi 'gal lo //
translated: Since the shadow of a tree changes due to the size of the tree trunk and branches and so on, the size of the shadow increases and decreases and it is not contradictory that the shadow moves when the tree moves.

original: gzhan yang ; ji ltar shing ljon pa log na grib ma log pa ltar /
analyzed: gzhan yang ; ji ltar shing ljon pa log na grib ma log pa ltar /
translated: Moreover, just as the shadow of a tree moves when the tree moves,

original: rnam par rig byed log pa na rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ldog par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed log pa na rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ldog par 'gyur na /
translated: when indicative form changes, nonindicative form would change.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so,

original: de ni de rnam par 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de ni de rnam par 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it does not follow the change of indicative form.

original: / gzhan dag na re rten gyi 'byung ba la gzugs su yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen snga ma ste /
analyzed: / gzhan dag na re rten gyi 'byung ba la gzugs su yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen snga ma ste /
translated: Others say: It is form because it exists as form in the primary elements that are its basis.

original: sngon po la sogs pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs su 'byung ba la brten pa ni 'byung ba dang / grub pa dang / bde ba gcig par mthong ba ste /üîΩde'i phyir rgyur byas pa'i @37a * //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs su 'byung ba la brten pa ni 'byung ba dang / grub pa dang / bde ba gcig par mthong ba ste / de'i phyir rgyur byas pa'i @37a * //
translated: The former master Vasubandhu says: Form derived from the primary elements such as blue is seen to be established and to exist as form in the primary elements that are its basis.

original: gzugs yin pas 'di yang rten gyi 'byung ba la gzugs su yod pa'i phyir gzugs su rung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs yin pas 'di yang rten gyi 'byung ba la gzugs su yod pa'i phyir gzugs su rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, since it is form derived from the primary elements, it is suitable as form because it exists as form in the primary elements that are its basis.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gzhan ni gzugs su yod pa dngos su khas blangs pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gzhan ni gzugs su yod pa dngos su khas blangs pa'i phyir la /
translated: Other form derived from the primary elements is accepted as existing as form in the primary elements that are its basis because it is impeded.

original: 'di ni thogs pa med pa'i phyir rten gyi sgo kho nas gzugs su rung ba yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: 'di ni thogs pa med pa'i phyir rten gyi sgo kho nas gzugs su rung ba yin no zhe'o //
translated: But this is suitable as form only in the sense that it is the basis of the primary elements that are its support because it is unimpeded.

original: de lta na ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de lta na ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: If that is so, then eye consciousness and so on are also form because they exist as form in the primary elements that are their basis.

original: de rnams kyi rten mig la sogs pa dag ni thogs pa dang bcas pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rten mig la sogs pa dag ni thogs pa dang bcas pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: The eyes, etc., which are their supports, are resistant.

original: nye bar bkod pa 'di ni mi mthun pa yin te zhes bya ba ni de nyid lan smra ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar bkod pa 'di ni mi mthun pa yin te zhes bya ba ni de nyid lan smra ba'o //
translated: This example is not apt,

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni ljon pa la grib ma nyid dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni ljon pa la grib ma nyid dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: because noninformative form is like a tree and its shade, like a gem and its radiance, and like the pleasure and the one who experiences the pleasure.

original: ji ltar ljon pa dang / grib ma dang / nor bu dang / 'od grub pa dang / bde ba gcig pa de bzhin du rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yang 'byung ba dag dang / grub pa dang / bde ba gcig go snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: ji ltar ljon pa dang / grib ma dang / nor bu dang / 'od grub pa dang / bde ba gcig pa de bzhin du rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yang 'byung ba dag dang / grub pa dang / bde ba gcig go snyam du dgongs so //
translated: Just as a tree and its shade, or a gem and its radiance, or pleasure and the one who experiences pleasure, are established and exist in the same way, so too are noninformative form and the primary elements established and exist in the same way.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag ni de ltar mig la sogs pa dag grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag ni de ltar mig la sogs pa dag grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa ma yin no //
translated: Eye consciousness, etc., are not established and do not exist in the same way as the eyes, etc.

original: de dag ni de dag gi skye ba'i rgyu mtshan tsam 'ba' zhig tu zad pas so zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de dag ni de dag gi skye ba'i rgyu mtshan tsam 'ba' zhig tu zad pas so zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: They are merely the conditions for the arising of those.

original: dbang po da dag ni rnam par shes pa de dag gi skye ba'i rgyu mtshan te /
analyzed: dbang po da dag ni rnam par shes pa de dag gi skye ba'i rgyu mtshan te /
translated: These faculties are the causal signs of the arising of those consciousnesses.

original: bskyed par bya ba rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ro //
translated: They are the causal signs of what is to be generated.

original: 'di ni re zhig bya brag tu smra ba ma yin te zhes bya ba la /üîΩ'di bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi yin pa ni bye brag tu smra ba'i 'o //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig bya brag tu smra ba ma yin te zhes bya ba la / 'di bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi yin pa ni bye brag tu smra ba'i 'o //
translated: This is not the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika position.üîΩThis is the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika position.

original: bye brag tu smra ba'i ma yin pa ni bye brag tu smra ba'i ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba'i ma yin pa ni bye brag tu smra ba'i ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is not the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika position.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: shing ljon pa la brten nas grib ma dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o ;
analyzed: shing ljon pa la brten nas grib ma dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o ;
translated: It is the extensive passage beginning, ‚ÄúShadow and light are based on trees.‚Äù

original: / ji ltar bye brag tu smra ba'i ma yin zhe na /üîΩgrib ma la sogs pa kha dog gi rdul phra rab rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / ji ltar bye brag tu smra ba'i ma yin zhe na / grib ma la sogs pa kha dog gi rdul phra rab rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: How is this not the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika position?üîΩIt is the passage beginning, ‚ÄúShadow and so on are subtle particles of color.‚Äù

original: de la grib ma dang 'od ces bya ba ni kha dog gi gzugs kho na la brjod la /
analyzed: de la grib ma dang 'od ces bya ba ni kha dog gi gzugs kho na la brjod la /
translated: Shadow and light are said to be only the form of color.

original: kha dog gi rdul phra rab rnams ni rang gi 'byung ba bzhi tshan la brten pa'i phyir shing ljon pa la sogs pa dag rten du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: kha dog gi rdul phra rab rnams ni rang gi 'byung ba bzhi tshan la brten pa'i phyir shing ljon pa la sogs pa dag rten du mi 'dod do //
translated: The subtle particles of color are not considered to be the support of trees, etc., because they are based on the four great elements.

original: grib ma dang 'od de ga la brten pa yin yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: grib ma dang 'od de ga la brten pa yin yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Even though shadow and light are based on something,

original: shing ljon pa dang nor bu dag la brten pa nyid do //
analyzed: shing ljon pa dang nor bu dag la brten pa nyid do //
translated: they are based on trees, etc., and on jewels.

original: gang dag ce na /
analyzed: gang dag ce na /
translated: What are they?

original: grib ma dang 'od dag ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: grib ma dang 'od dag ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The text continues: ‚Äúshadow and light.‚Äù

original: grib ma dang 'od ni rang gi 'byung ba la brten la /
analyzed: grib ma dang 'od ni rang gi 'byung ba la brten la /
translated: Shadow and light are based on their own great elements.
